input_doc: I came here for the last 2 nights of my trip to San Fran, and the people running the place are verrrry nice! And it's so much quieter than a hotel where people run in and out of rooms all night! It's beautiful--the rooms that are larger are great (mine was a small yellow one upstairs with not much of a view at all, so I"d advise one of the larger ones unless you'd like to save a bit of $). If you can ignore the really dirty hallway wallpaper and carpets (I think they last changed the wallpaper and washed the carpets 40 years ago!), you'll like the place! The only other really odd thing was that they have carpeting in the bathrooms--wall-to-wall carpeting!!! But the great staff --and cafes nearby--make up for the fact that the owner is letting their building fall apart!

When I was looking for hotels in Chicago most that I came across cost waaaay more than the Holiday Inn. I was grateful when I found such reasonable prices considering the prices of the other hotels in the area. I was so excited to find that the hotel was exceptionally nice considering the price which makes it a no brainer as to where we will stay any time we visit Chicago! We had a nice view of the city and the river below, our room was spacious, clean, and the bed and pillows were sooo comfortable! Being attached to the Merchandise Mart was great because we could walk to coffee shops without having to go outside, and being able to walk to the metro through the Merchandise Mart was great! A few blocks away is Lou Malnati's which has great deep dish pizza and on the bottom floor of the Merchandise Mart I really liked the blueberry muffin I had at Au Bon Pain. I am very happy with my experience and am grateful that I saved hundreds of dollars by staying here!

input_doc: I had read great reviews about the Alexis, but I didn't expect it to be so great! We arrived late on Friday evening and were greeted as if we were the most important people there. We immediately went up to our room, which was upgraded for us and the room was impeccable, beautifully decorated, spacious, and spotless. We had some travel hiccups getting to Seattle, so we were starving (and ready for a cocktail) by the time we checked in. We headed down to the Library Bistro for a drink and a bite to eat. The kitchen was technically closed by the time we got down there, but the chef agreed to still allow us to get something off of the appetizer menu, which we greatly appreciated. We also loved the location-quick access to the waterfront and Pike's Place Market. We absolutely loved staying here and would definitely stay here again!!!

input_doc: This hotel was very nice!! As soon as you walk into the lobby your mind goes to "aaaaah" mode. The lobby decor is lovely, very comtemporary and colorful. We stayed just one night, in a King Suite. The huge plasma tv swivels and provides an excellent view from either side of the semi divided wall. Decent amount of space for two adults and two four year olds. The bed was sooo comfortable! The sofa was as cozy as the one in my own home and it was just as nice at night when converted into the sleeper. This hotel is about 20 minutes from Beale Street and the view isnt "excellent" but the price, combined with the cleanliness and the warmth of the hotel, gets my vote!

input_doc: just came back from nyc. stayed at the hudson, and loved it! everyone was so friendly and nice, the place is beautiful, modern, chic but soooo warm at the same time. the rooms are small, but so cute and very well thought out and put together. it was a little drafty from the direction of the window, but not unbearable at night when I had my heater off, and didn't even notice during the day when I was using the heater. the patio was unfortunately closed due to the weather conditions, but can just imagine how beautiful it is in spring/summer. warmly recommed it!

input_doc: Great front-desk staff, but the remodeling was sooo much beyond what I would tolerate again. The "breakfast room" was a disaster and the staff assigned to keep the lobby neat should not be allowed to talk on the phone while working. This Fairfield Inn needs another person in charge. Way overpriced for the accommodation while remodeling.

I have stay at this hotel whenever I am in New York City on business and will when I come for leisure. The location, rooms and service is great. Very friendly and accomodating staff - greet me by name when I come in. The breakfast is great - omellettes made the way you want. Rooms are comfortable. 
I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
One more thing the patio on street level is great for people watching in NYC.

input_doc: This hotel far exceeded me and my husband's expectations. We booked our room through hotwire.com and when we got there they upgraded us to a slightly larger room at no charge. Get this, we even had our 5 month old baby with us. Her packn'play fit conveniently in between our bed and the air conditioner which provided a lovely "white noise" to help the baby sleep. The beds are soooo comfy and the decore top notch paying attention to every little detail, nook, and cranny. For those saying that the rooms are tiny, they obviously didn't read about them before they booked. That's New York for you. The staff was much more friendly than I expected at such a stylish place and they had this wonderful service calle "The Acura Service". Tip: for a good and cheap breakfast go to the Cafe Metro just one block west or east of the hotel.

input_doc:
This is a HORRIBLE place to stay... First of all, they would not honor the internet rate(which was reduced from the standard weekly rate) and overcharged me...Escalated to Manager(Raj Patel) and he acted like he didn't understand what I was saying as a means to rectify the issue.... Even the corporate franchise owner(Accor North America) refuses to be manageable when dealing through the Better Business Bureau..
Even if I'd gotten the discounted rate, this place was horrible.. My room didn't lock (Rm #246), so I had to pack up & move my things to my truck while gone... The heater/AC unit blew out a foul odor on either setting... There were shady characters hanging around the back side maybe selling drugs & with overly dressed up women walking the parking lot.. Office staff didn't speak english & refused to address these issues described above... I wonder if the Sheriffs Dept knows of the criminal enterprise being supported by the motel Management & its Corporate entity... ??

input_doc: THIS PLACE IS DISGUSTING!!!! My friends and I stayed there just for the night before our trip to Cancun and let me tell you that we didn't even make it the whole night!!! To start off, the employees at the front desk were none to helpful. We get to our room only to find what looked like a murder scene !..There was literally a bloody handprint on the wall!!! And to boot the toilet had some kind of "snakeskin" floating around in it, it was flushed and overflowed..So we get moved to another room only to find dried blood stains on the sheets..We couldn't even stand to be there for one night..Packed up our stuff and left at 3 am...Someone needs to call the board of health on this hotel, because it is an absolute SCUMHOLE!!!!

input_doc: Please don't believe the hype of the excellent to good reviews because they are probably being written by the hotel staff at this particular location. I recently stayed at this hotel on 12/3/2011 and I am a gold hilton honors member. Let me tell you, the service at this location is non-existent, no room service, no valet or parking service, no respect from the staff at the hotel and when I addressed my issues with the hotel manager, she didn't want to speak to me face-to-face unless security was present. Scared of little old me??? Wow. Anyway, my experience at this hotel was not pleasant and I was inconvenienced by engineering multiple times and had to go off premise in order to get a meal. There buffet breakfast hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. so don't plan to be in your room late because they will try to snatch it from you when you go to breakfast. Check out suppose to be at noon but the housekeepers discourage you staying until then with all of the noises they make at 7:00 a.m. waking up all of the guests. I stayed at better Hilton hotels than this particular one. Go elsewhere. Room wasn't cleaned properly either.

input_doc:
After spending our first night at the Hotel Pennsylvania, we knew we were in the right area of NYC but definitely in the WRONG hotel. After a quick search, we packed our bags and headed to the Radisson just a block away. The front desk management and staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. They had us setup with a room and even provided a complimentary breakfast coupon while we waited on our room to be cleaned.
Ahhh - the room. What a difference it made in our trip to have a room with clean new carpet, sleep number beds, nice tv's with a good selection of channels, soft bath towels, free wireless internet, and a staff that is ready to serve you at all areas of the hotel.
The location is perfect if your looking for great subway access, walking distance to Time Square...

input_doc: My husband and I always stay at the Admiral Fell Inn every time we go to Baltimore. We always have a great time and no complaints about the hotel. Everyone is always nice and the room is always clean. We stayed on St. Patty's day weekend. The weather was horrible the whole time but at least we still had a great time, except for getting our car locked in the PMI parking garage because they are closed on Sundays and they don't tell you that before you park there and then when you go to leave on Sunday you find out that your really not leaving until Monday after 6 am! But luckily someone had a monthly pass to the parking garage and let us in and out and we didn't have to pay for parking, Saved us alot of money. input_doc: We were very pleased with the one week stay we just had at the Opal. It was a number of years ago that I stayed at this hotel, but from seeing the other reviews, I am under the sense that things have yet to get any better.
When we stayed there, the first room that we were put in had mold all over the walls - ick! We asked to be moved, and they did so. input_doc: Everything was great nice frontdesk people...........clean room............nice "free" breakfast. The only small complaint I have is that they took my creditcard and preapproved a charge for "just in case" which there were none. One day was 10 dollars and the next was 15 dollars..........what was wrong with one dollar that the gas stations usually charge??? Of course these charges were gone after 72 hours, but it did upset me. BUT other then that it was a very nice hotel............close to major highway and nice restaurants.

This is a small boutique hotel near the mall. Lot's of shopping, dining and other alternatives. It is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. The staff was friendly, helpful and generally fun. Fun because they can get to know their guests (due to the size). No request was denied. The continental breakfast was better than average and the evening "happy hour" was wonderful. Wine, cheese, meats and fruits. If this is an example of the "Stash Hotel Group" I will try to stay in their hotels again. Great job!!!

input_doc: I recently stayed in August, 2012 at this hotel for 5 nights, and found it to be extremely comfortable & very well managed. The staff are a credit to your organisation. input_doc: I made a reservation at this hotel for myself, my husband and 2 yr old daughter, little did I know that the walls are paper thin ... you can hear the people next door having intercourse... There was no weather stripping on the doors or windows so all the traffic noise, and bugs got in. This was only the beginning, we stayed 6 nights, every night there was shouting on the staircases by our hotel door, drunken fools in the parking lot, and people with their t.v.'s blairing at 4 a.m., all which we complained about and recieved no help from the front desk. The room itself had torn and old comforters, stained walls and not very big at all. We have stayed on Hotel circle many times, and NEVER been so disappointed in a hotel as this last trip, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and even though you save a little money, it's not worth a goodnights sleep, and comfort... NEVER AGAIN!!!!

input_doc:
I had the pleasure of staying at the W in June for holiday with friends, stayed in a Mega room and was fantastic, the hotel was lovely and clean and experienced some great staff. The Whisky Blu is a great end to the night, one night we watched a single bar tender serving a full bar with no problems.
The room was great, lovely and spacious with an excellent seating area to relax, the bathroom was huge. Had a lovely welcome gift from the GM, Mr Maynard wich was also lovely.
Location is great, 10 mins from Times Square and a nice walk down 5th Ave to Central Park, I am returning again to celebrate New Years Eve and can't wait to go back!!!!

input_doc:
During our honeymoon road trip, we stayed at The Argonaut for one night on 9/19. The location is awesome, and we had no problem pulling up at peak time in the afternoon and having our car picked up by the valet. 
Our room was decorated in a nautical theme, and had a view of the park next door and of the trolley turnaround. We didn't make it to the wine tasting that evening, but it sounded like a nice feature.
Beds were great, bathroom was great, and the minibar offered playing cards and other trinkets in addition to just snacks. There was also a DVD player available and free internet service.
Our window opened up, so it was nice to get some fresh air and to hear the sounds of the street. 
There's a nice courtyard area with a couple of bars and restaurants right next door if you don't want to go far, and that park has a little beach with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
I'm already looking for excuses to stay here again on our next vacation. Highly recommend!!!

input_doc: I love staying here on my trips to D.C. It is close to everything and the nice "apartment" is like a home away from home. The management is very attentive - Vinh has been longtime manager and will go out of his way to meet every need. Here's the problem: The luxurious pillow-top bed makes it hard to get up and out on time. The spacious shower with multiple shower heads makes it difficult to take a quick shower. It is soooo quiet that you don't know the bustle of the D.C. is going on around you. There is a nice little store right around the corner that is the perfect place for great snacks when you want to skip your social events and park in front of the flat screen for the evening. If you don't have will power, this place will take you down. You will think you died and went to heaven.

input_doc: My first nights was uneventful I showered went to bed woke up had a hot waffle and went about my day.The second night I got in real late and went right to bed. When I woke up the next morning........ No hot water, put on my clothes and went to breakfast......No hot coffee, No waffle mix, Wafflle iorn was unplugged,No orange juice. Complained to the desk and the guy said the water line was broke and he would have to get a plumber. He also said he would make coffee but, It was almost 7 AM and I needed to go. input_doc: The Strand Hotel offers excellent quality in every area. Staff is friendly, breakfast is great, bed is sooo comfortable, towels are sooo plush, restaurant has great food and you are close to many eateries and souvenir stores. Would definitely return there if in NY again.
I think i was upgraded i have a huuuge room that i could live in. Great location and service. Booked on hotwire. I love the street noise. I love nyc.

This hotel was very inexpensive compared to others in the area and in a great location, however, I would never return to it again! The room smelled musty, the bathroom tub didn't drain, and there were stains on the sheet and carpet. The lobby had been remodeled and was ok for an inexpensive hotel, but the rooms are in desperate need of work. input_doc:
We spent five days in NYC and stayed at the Park Lane hotel, which has the best location and view in NYC at a good value. It is steps away from the subway and walking distance of most tourist attractions. 
The property is a little old and could use improvments in the bathrooms, furniture, mattresses and doors (there is an aprox 3 inch space between the doors and the floor so you get to hear a lot of noise!). Some improvents in the cleanliness of the rooms would be welcome as well as a quieter housekeeping staff that seems to forget that most guests are on holiday and want to rest and not be awoken by their extremely loud chatter everyday. 
Most of the staff are very friendly and service oriented. All our requests were tended to readily and professionally. The first night we hardly got any sleep because the bed was sooo soft, but we called housekeeping and they took care of it right away.
All in all the pluses outrank the minuses of this property. We will go back in our next trip.

input_doc: The hotel is superbly situated right in the heart if everything. We found it easily from the airport using the BART. The rooms are what you would expect of a city hotel and although dated they have character. The staff were all lovely and helpful. We loved the fact that tea/coffee and cookies were free all day, (saved a fortune on breakfast) free internet and free iced water all day. We could go shopping take stuff back to the room without having to carry it around all day. I made a comment that the towels were old and the next thing we had new towels delivered to the room. If visiting again would defo stay here, that says a lot on my book!!!!

input_doc:
My Husband and I stayed here for the labour day long weekend. We have been travelling to NY city for almost 17 years but it was our first time at Giraffe. We liked the location, close proximity to everything. It was recommended by our friends who also love staying there.
The hotel itself is small and staff very personable. They serve a continental breakfast, there's an evening turn down service, a roof top patio which we didn't use because we weren't arounding during happy hour. Our room was very spacious, king bed with an adjacent sitting room and a little fridge in the room which we loved. Nice spot to return to after a full day of activities and shopping in Manhattan to relax and enjoy a cold beer or a nice glass of wine before dinner.
No relation to the hotel but there a fabulous restaurant next door Los Caminos, the food is sooo good and a must try is the red sangria.
Will be staying at Hotel Giraffe again.

The staff is really kind and helpful, Blue Fin restaurant is definetly tasty (maybe a little pricey, but dining in Times Square is an experience which worth every penny) and the rooms are sooo nice!! input_doc: Convenient location within walking distance of most cultural, historical, and family oriented attractions including Rittenhouse Square, Antique Row and the Academy of Natural Sciences. Adjacent to Liberty Place with over 70 unique boutiques and restaurants and easily accessible to the convention center, 30th Street train station, and major universities. As a solo, woman traveler I felt safe. Great restaurant/bar in hotel with superior service and comfortable ambiance. Room was small but for a single business traveler it's perfect. Gym was great for quick cardio and a little weight lifting in the a.m. Filtered water dispenser on each floor. Lounge with coffee and tea, comfortable couches, local magazines/tourist info. input_doc: My friends and I all decided to stay here for a bday weekend 20+ people from LA and SF. I booked a "Suite" which while I will say the space big, there was nothing "Sweet" about it. The bed was uncomfortable, poor linen and towl quality, bathroom door fell off the hinges, modern decor cheap and tacky, used IKEA at best. The bathroom was disgusting, and overall the room was just not clean nor was it comfortable. WE BOOKED out of the hotel the next morning! By the way, the whole rooftop bar access is sooooo ridiculous. They give you wristbands at check-in, which if you dont have on, they wont let you up, even if you are a guest! I am glad we partied at the Figueroa, should have stayed at the WESTIN! Waste of $400!

input_doc: We stayed in room 120 and we found the room to be very clean and comfortable. It had all the amenities that we needed. The bed was unbelievably comfortable!!!!! input_doc:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before my move from Dubai to Chicago. It was the perfect place for my last two nights of living in Chicago. The location is fantastic...right next to the Grand stop on the Red Line, and just a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. There are so many great restaurants surounding the hotel, including the Webber Grill, which is attached to the hotel.
Our room was very spacious and comfortable. Lots of great channels on the television, a coffeemaker, and a good hairdryer. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially with the 7 pieces of luggage we brought for my big flight/move to Dubai.
So, if you want a stellar downtown location and great Hilton quality and service, book this hotel. We were SOOO pleased!

Between September 9-12 we stayed this hotel.
We booked a standard room.
But we were lucky, our rooom was on 15th floor and lake front at the corner.
Room is clear and comfortable.
View was perfect esp around 6 am you can witness the sunrise just in front of you.
We made our reservation over Priceline with $80/night-room.

input_doc: We spent 5 nights at the hotel in a 1 Bedroom Suite, which had a double sofa bed in the lounge. Great for our family as we have two children 19 and 16 so the extra room fitted in well for us but saved on the cost of a seperate bedroom. The hotel is in a great location, 10 mins max walk to Time square and just off Lexington. 5th Avenue also about 5 - 10 mins dependent on your pace. BREAKFAST at the hotel toooo expensive but plenty of places to eat and can highly recommend "LaBaguette" on Lexington so just a short walk from the hotel and also Grand Central has a fab little cafe for breakfast and all at reasonable prices. Gym at the hotel is fine for a short stay and never very busy as my 19 year old son used this daily. I investigated lots of hotels and areas to stay but was glad I chose the Barclay,

input_doc:
Although there were renovations going on I detected many problems,the rooms are new and nice.
Pro's - the front staff was nice and very helpful, lobby beautifully decorated, rooms were clean.
Con's - the elevator is in poor condition, 2nd and 3rd floors smelled something bad(1st floor where they were working was fine the a/c was in full blast, very comfortable) They stated that the beds were full but actually they were very small doubles. 
The doors are not study and it was a crack so that you are able to see into the hallway-and if you can see you can hear believe me, I checked at least 11 doors.The pool was the worst!!!!! I looked and smell like sewage even if it did not you could not enjoy the lawn chairs everything was nasty.
I did look inside a king room and it also seem to be nice and clean with a ref. and microwave. I would not stay in this hotel again but will visit the chain again.

we neamed our own price on the room and for $100 in that location around all the attractions you get in walking distance it is a goooood rate.

input_doc: Friendly, professional, helpful staff. Great ammentites, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and nice TV. Staff is extremely helpful and exhaustes all efforts to meet your needs. My girlfriend forgot her cell phone charger at home, when we arrived at the hotel i asked the front desk staff if they might have a charger that would fit her phone, they sent one up within 15 minutes of our arrival. Great fitness center and PHENOMENAL bar on the 27th floor. Floor to ceiling windows with beautiful view of the Denver skyline. You would be hard pressed to find more bang for your buck when staying downtown. A legitimate FOUR STAR hotel at an affordable price, i highly recommend staying here, you will not be disappointed!!!

input_doc:
Staying at Public Chicago is really an experience that I would highly recommend to others. The design aesthetic is chic and elegantly simple. Beautifully detailed and not overly designed. There are all the modern touches, but somehow it still has retained a sense of warmth that makes you truly feel welcome and at home (in a good way). 
The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and professional and they really made you feel like they were happy you were there. There are so many cool hotels, that have staff that make you feel like you are an unwelcome guest at their party, this was definitely not the case at Public. The common areas perhaps add to this welcoming feeling, the lobby, the library and restaurant were all very open and flowed into each other really nicely. 
I didn't eat there, but the design in the Pump Room was pretty awesome. While on the subject of food though, I loooooved the express room service concept, affordable and fast and the french toast was evil it was so good.
Neighborhood was beautiful, overall a really great way to spend some time in Chicago.

input_doc: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days for a convention and enjoyed every moment of it. Staff was great; especially Brian, the gentleman that brought our bags to our room and informed us of all the great places to go--beginning with the best food to be had a Reading Terminal Market, which is just across the street. There is a great little bar to the left of the lobby, in the hotel, that is friendly and busy, and they make wonderful white chocolate martinis! Everyone here was helpful and the hotel is quiet at night and in the mornings, if you can sleep in a bit--the beds are soooo comfortable; a cloud of soft sheets, down comforters and many pillows! If you are looking for good food, at a cool place, at a really decent price, call ahead and make a reservation at Bleu, in Rittenhouse Square. There is shopping and more restaurants even closer to the hotel , and a 7-11 convenience store right across from the entrance, for bringing snacks into your room. input_doc: Would definitely recommmend the hotel for its locations and the panorama from the rooms. Front desk staff could be more helpful though!

I just returned from a short stay at the Maxwell Hotel and I can't wait to go back. I have had the opportunity to stay at wonderful hotels (Four Seasons on Lanai - Hyatt San Francisco, etc) and I must say that the Maxwell Hotel is now my favorite Hotel of all. From the moment of check in, I knew this place was special. The guy who checked me in was great and he introduced me to Mario ( manager) who was equally as great. The room had everything you could want and more. It even had a Keurig coffee maker folks!!! We had a great view of the Space Needle from the room. input_doc: I can't remember when I stayed in a nicer place. The staff was very pleasant, and the hotel is perfectly located for my purposes. My room was soooo comfortable, I wish I could stay for a few weeks.

The hotel was fab. In a fantastic location in Midtown Manhattan. We only stayed in a standard room (ie not a suite) but the beds were sooo comfortable and the room was plush. The porters and concierge were lovely, helpful and didn't ask for or expect a tip once, although we did tip right at the end of the holiday. The receptionists were polite but a bit sullen and not over-friendly which was the only downside. We even got a daily $10 voucher each for a meal in the ajoining restaurant, Ferro's where we ate a lovely and reasonable priced lunch. All-in-all a fantastic place to stay and I would definately stay there again!

input_doc: If you expect this to be a "nice" hotel with amenities do not ignore the negative reviews!!! input_doc: This was a great hotel, sooooo clean I was impressed. I would give it 5-stars, except that I didn't sleep so well because the A/C would turn on and off and I woke up every time. I ended up sleeping with a pillow over my head. BUT I am a very light sleeper--my husband slept just fine, so if you're a normal sleeper, I wouldn't worry about it. input_doc:

Centrally located with great restaurants and shops close by and only a 3 minute walk to the Houston Subway Station. This line takes you up to 42nd Street or down to the South Ferry.
The staff are friendly and very accommodating. Very clean and updated rooms.

input_doc:
It was a real disappointment for us, the images shown in the website are way too far from reality, the hotel in general can be considered as dirty, smelly, messy..... and trash under the bed!
My room was not cleaned in two days of the four days that we stay there and the explanation was that was a personal item over the bed.... the item was a bottle of freshener air !!!!!
the towels when we were lucky to have some where smelly, wet and very , very small. in the bath curtain had mould.
In the hall way there was a lot of trash and dog poop 
We asked for a retribution for the bad service, and all that we got was an "apology" and a request of not letting this influence our future decision to stay in the hotel.
bottom line.. in three words... DON'T STAY THERE !!!!!!!!!!!!!

input_doc:
We stayed here over NYE. The location is great very close to Michigan Ave, surrounded by some superb Restaurants & close to all attractions. The hotel itself is lovely, the decor hardwood floors, concrete beams, very loft like, we had a corner room with floor to ceiling glass on both sides, awesome!!! 
The bathroom is great, i loved the rain-shower & the toiletries are off a very high standard. Service is good. The only reason i didn't give 5 stars is because one day after calling down for my car we waited 30 mins (They said the didn't get the message from the front desk) & at check out they added honor bar costs we didn't have. 
The Gym is very good, we tried to book the spa but it was full & we didn't eat her due to the fact that so may good choices are on your doorstep 
We would return here again, i would suggest try your best & book a corner room.

input_doc: The hotel itself isn't the most amazing thing I've ever seen but the beds are to die for!!! They call it sweet dreams package and it is!!! No balconies on rooms or on any floor - if you smoke you have to go all the way outside the front door. Bathroom is odd - sink and vanity look new/updated while the tub/shower looks dated. input_doc: We stayed here again for the 3rd or 4th time and once again it was amazing! I love this hotel!!! We travelled all night and arrived in the city at about 8:30am. We wanted to just check our bags with the bellman knowing that we would check in several hours later. But the man at the front desk let us check in at 9am!!!! We couldnt believe it. input_doc:
I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in mid-March and was so disappointed with everything. The room was small, the carpets in the looby were smelly, no bathtub in the washroom and view of brick walls from the windows. Not even free internet which even the cheapest hotels offer these days. It costs $10/day to connect to internet. If you want to use internet in the lobby, minimum charge is $5 per use. To use the phone in the rooms for local calls, it is $1.25/15mins and then 10 cents every min. Even the local calls are charged, what a rip off!!! Every hotel I have stayed at offers free intercontinetal breakfast, of course no such thing at this hotel. No indoor pool, go figure.
I won this from bidding process at priceline, I will be reluctant to use this service and this hotel in future.

input_doc: I recently stayed here when I was in town to see a Nationals game. I thought the place was terrific. The location wasn't bad-my nephew and I were able to walk to the Smithsonian and even over to the Lincoln Memorial at night. Granted-it was a loooong walk, but fun and safe. There is a metro stop on the corner right by the hotel which was also very convienent. The rooms themselves were very spacious and comfortable. The store in the lobby had a large selection and the service was great. The pool and gym were also nice. My only complaint was the price-$380 on a week night seemed a little steep. Would definately stay again.

input_doc: We stayed at the Hilton after spending one night in a horrible "boutique" san Francisco hotel. The lobby was always busy, the hotel restaurant also with a line far outside the door. After having a light lunch here one day, glad we didn't spend time waiting in this line for breakfast. Mediocre food and service. Fitness center was decent, room service food very good but slooow. Overall, not a bad place to stay in the city.

My daughter and I stayed in this hotel in April 2006. As we were travelling alone, safety was very important to us and we found the hotel to be in a very good, central location. The reception staff were very helpful with tourist information and buses etc. We had a double room and unlike most other US hotels we had stayed in, the room only had 1 queen size bed and the room was quite small. It was perfectly adequate though for the short amount of time we actually spent in the room and it was very clean. The free breakfast in the morning is good. The hotel is located about a 10 min walk away from the beginning of Fisherman's Wharf which is a great place to go both during the day time and early evening with street performers and artists. BUT beware of the Bush man!!!! We really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and would definitely go back there and the hotel.

input_doc: The service was great and the beds were soooo comfy ... I love feather beds/pillows!!!!! We got room service one night and it was also very good :) The maids even made a point to come see us upon checkout to say thank you for coming. We were very impressed. Only thing lacking is a pool/hot tub. It was chilly and we would have loved to go relax in the pool, but its an older building and we knew it didn't have one going into it. Its literally next door to the Hancock Tower, and blocks away from the beach. We walked to Gino's East, and Jake Melnick's Corner Tap *YUM* Valet guys were nice, but we've had better. input_doc: Just got home from Chicago. Stayed 2 nights at the Essex. The reason we ended up there was their Buddy Guy Package. Hotel was nice and clean and the staff, especially Chris and Rico, were very helpful to us. Moved us to a smoking room after we got there because i forgot to request one. input_doc: I stayed for two days at this La Quinta Inn, and loved it! It was clean, cozy, comfortable, and had all the amenities I wanted, which include a refrigerator, and microwave! This property sits next to a Denny's BUT there is also an excellent Mexican restaurant on the other side, open 8 to 8, and I ate very good there!!!! input_doc: I needed a hotel close to my son and couldn't find any I could afford. I was truly amazed how comfortable and quiet this hotel was. It took me a bit longer to get there but it was worth it. The front staff was helpful and friendly and other stafff members were also. There was a good variety of food for breakfast. There was plenty of parking which if you have stayed in LA and areas, parking is a issue. input_doc: This Holdiday inn is a very nice, very clean place to stay!! It is very small but I am sure you can expect that with most places in NYC. The breakfast was good and even though it was very busy they kept it well stocked! Staff was friendly and very helpful. The only thing is that the "name" is really not true!! This hotel is NOT in Time Square, it is about 4-5 blocks away, which is not bad but I really was expecting to be in time square!! Parking at the HI is $55.00 a night but they are very helpful to tell you of other places that are cheaper (and they took good care of our car). I would stay here again for sure!!!

input_doc:
Just had a 4 night stay here and what a place. The building is amazing as are the staff. It's a real hangout for the stars. My wife and I was soaking up the sun at the Tropicana Pool Bar and on the next sun bed to us was Mr David Beckham. The next day was the premier after party for the movie 'Sparkle' 
its all sooooo Hollywood.
Hi to Mark, the bellman. Nice bloke

My family stayed at the San Jose Double Tree for my early birthday celebration. We went to the Winchester nighttime flashlight tour. The hotel is centrally located, easy to access from the airport and that is just the beginning! We were greeted by the valet who were very accommodating, and once inside to check in, we were greeted with delicious, hot cookies!!! I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel, and the rooms were wonderful! Staff was available for assistance anytime we needed them. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the food was outstanding!!! I would highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay there again! Thank you to the staff at San Jose Double Tree! We will see you again!!!!

input_doc: I like many people was a bit concerned about staying at this hotel after reading the many reviews. However, upon arrival our room was immediately upgraded to a junior suite - fantastic - it was huge. The room was clean and well looked after with coffee making facilities and a useful fridge if you wanted to keep your drinks cool. The air conditioning was a little noisy but I would rather have noisy air conditioning than no air conditioning - it was sooooo hot and humid in New York. They had a great Starbucks Coffee shop in the bar until 11.00am so you could get coffee (obviously) and a light breakfast which was really useful. The staff on the whole were very helpful and the concierge gave great advice when asked. The hotel was situated at 45th and Madison which was a great base for getting around the city. It was 2 minutes walk from Grand Central Station and 10-15 mins walk to Times Square. We would definitely recommend it and hope to stay there again.

input_doc: We had a great stay at the Hyatt Regency Hotel and Spa at Mission Bay! We had a total of three rooms. All of the rooms were not ready for us at the regular check-in time, however, they were extremely busy and were able to get us into two of the rooms right away. Alll rooms were upgraded to the newer tower rooms so we were OK with that! The facilities and grounds are immaculate. The pools were really nice. The staff were accomodating. We used the pool bar/grill, the gift shop and the Red Marlin restaurant and the Einstein Bagel Shop on site and had no problems whatsoever with anything. input_doc: Joy the one who helps you book the rooms is excellent at her job and is more than just a person on the other line...check in was good we were early and they got us in by 2pm....then I got a text from chase that they put a 150 dollar hold on my debit card I think I should have been told at check in especially since it was a debit card....the room was awesome, really clean modern and fun. They even refreshed the room while we were out for dinner but the slamming if the door next to us by the help was unprofessional though I must note it was during the day and they did not start again til about 830am again.... The staff though were really nice and helpful but we came back to hotel for a drink and asked the bartender if he was still serving and then the night doorman came running after us and said no bar is closed and he was not nice at all no smiles no help no jokes and took care of traffic up the street better than hotel guests but the day doorman I think Felix was amazing and delightful. The only other issue now is my entire stay was credited and I have no charge so before work tomorrow I have to go to chase and find out what is going on....I would return because it was sooo clean and location and day time staff but I will book with third party like hotels.com and then give credit card for their 150 dollar hold since the billing is obviously screwy........But it was one of the nicest places in nyc

input_doc: We stayed here for a long St. Patty's day get away for 4 sisters and Mom. Mom found this place in her AAA book and it was a great find. Good price, great location, and a fantastic time had by all. The rooms are clean and good size, bathrooms clean, but dated, and one AM with 5 "girls" getting ready we did blow a fuse by using 2 hair dryers(the front desk got it fixed in record time,must not have been the first time that happened). No hair dryers, no refrig, no coffee maker (free coffee and hot water 24/7 in front office). Walls were thin and it could be noisy from the other guests, and the street. The front desk people were outstanding and sooo friendly. They let some friends that had come to visit for the day park their cars without cost(twice). I would stay here again for the price and location.

input_doc:
Stayed here for 5 nights early September 2011 with a group of friends celebrating 2 birthdays. The hotel is in a great location. Our room looked out on to not only the Hudson River from one window but Madison Square Garden and The Empire State Building from the other.
The room was spacious, clean and the beds ever soooo comfortable. 
Breakfast's at the Tik Tok Diner are a must. Great Irish Bar called Tir Na Nog only a block away.
Only down fall for me was the constant noise from the traffic on a night from the street below. But then it is a city that never sleeps so i guess you can expect that. But other then that would definitley recommend this hotel to anybody.

input_doc: I had read so many bad reviews about this place after booking my stay that I thought oh no where am I taking my family!!!! BUT, this place upon arrival looks great , clean and our room was good. It's our first time staying at a resort and we booked with living social which I believe was worth the money we paid for. The waterpark is awesome my kids loved being there and they have many pools & even a ping pong table. The only downside to this place is their food, it is very expensive and very discusting. We had the BBQ buffet at the oasis and It was all fat, we tried the oasis snack bar and our buffalo chicken wings where black inside like this chicken was beyond dirty!!! Their food is pricey and not good at all. I'd stick to the fast food outside the hotel instead of buying anything there. I don't think I'd return only because id like to explore other resorts , overall the kids had a blast and didn't complain about anything :)

input_doc: I am a frequent business traveler and like to stay at W Hotels when I can. Well this was my first time at the W City Center and for surely will be my last. This so called newly renovated hotel is far from being up to the W standards that I'm used to seeing. My check in experience was the only good part of my stay sadly. I had a very nice Hispanic woman help me out and even got me an early check in and upgraded room. The so called upgraded room was a joke. The new design of the room looked cheap and apparently was as everything was falling apart or didnt work. No hot water, dirty sheets, and broken safe. Upon checking out I voiced my comments on my stay with a lady who claimed to be the manager yet she did absolutely nothing nor did she even seem phased when I said that I wouldnt be returning...hmmm do they hear this all the time that they just dont care?

input_doc:
I know there are grande dames in Boston hotel circles. . but for comfort, location, staffing, and facilities, the Hotel Commonwealth cannot be beat.
I stay at the property each year during a baseball trip. . . and Fenway Park is just around the corner. . but even if you weren't doing baseball, this hotel has the best of all possible worlds in a great location.
If I have one complaint and it is minor. .. food service is not particularly to my tastes. . why not just good food but efforts are made to modernize and make it trendy, which seems to distract what otherwise would be a great dining experience. 
All hotel groupies should try this place!!!!

input_doc: The rooms at the Gunter are large with amazingly high ceilings, and the building's public spaces are wonderful (check out the bar!). Despite this, the bathrooms feel like public toilets, the amenities are bare and these few things make the place feel like your average business hotel than anything else. It is close to everything and that is great, but being in the middle of a city that likes to clean its streets all night long can make for a noisy evening. During my three evenings at the Gunter I woke each night to noise...that could be a problem for many people....

All employees were professional and very helpful!! Everyone one was polite and the customer service was outstanding!! We have not received this type of service in a very long time. Would also like to compliment the maid service. They were very accommodating and did an outstanding job. Thank you again for making our vacation a wonderful experience. We would stay here again and again!!!

input_doc: What a trip, what a view. I have always loved NY but never stayed anywhere in the city that compares to the SoHo Grand. The staff were polite and friendly, the room was on the 15th floor overlooking the whole of the Manhattan skyline, we fell asleep and woke to a view of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings, the CD collection was great, the complimentary goldfish (Geronimo) gurgled happily in the corner of our room and the bar is VERY trendy. SoHo/Greenwich Village area of NY are definitely the coolest places to be and a tranquil haven after a busy day touring the City. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and don't be put off by the comments elsewhere about unfriendly staff or noise, if you're friendly, they're friendly!!!

input_doc:
I booked the St.Giles - Tuscany for the weekend of my husbands 40th birthday in which the entire weekend was a set up for a surprise party I planned at the nearby Lucky Strikes Manhattan. Upon checking in from the entry way & the sitting area to the orange infused water and the bubbly bell hop we were impressed. It takes a lot to impress my husband and I as we are both very meticulous about places we visit and stay. 
I informed the staff at the front desk that I was having a SURPRISE party for my husband the next day during the afternoon and they were very supportive, interested and GOOD at keeping a secret.
Some friends I had to fly in from Chicago to assist in the surprise stayed next door at the sister hotel St. Giles - Court and everything and everyone there was exceptional as well. I absolutely LOVE the hotel and we will indeed stay there again, we found tons of things to do in the area and more things are just a cab ride away.. Soooo much FUN!!

I was there for a long weekend getaway. The woman at the front desk upgraded us to a special deluxe room with water view. Let me tell you, the room was amazing!!! It was a corner room with floor to ceiling glass on two sides and we can view the harbor and the financial district and the galleria mall across the street. The view was absolutely stunning. The hotel is beautiful and classy and very close to everything within Inner Harbour. The only downside is the expensive parking but its expected since its such a classy hotel in the middle of a major city. Parking on the streets is hard so its worth the price. It was about $20 a day but I forget. Overall, the hotel is beautiful as there is nothing less expected from Hyatts.

input_doc:
Stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower recently. Very nice hotel in excellent location.
Rooms were good size, service was fantastic.
If I had one small gripe though, it was that they charge for room internet access. Not overly expensive mind you ($10 per day from memory) but we found the majority of hotels we visited on this trip to the US had room wi-fi as complimentary.
Didn't deter from the overall stay....we plan to head back to Chicago in the future and this hotel will be top of our list. Can't wait to get back.

input_doc: I hate to say it , but this place is really really BAD!!!!! input_doc: Had a very nice experience at this hotel. Yes the rooms are small like some other reviewers have said, but you get that with any older hotel building in the city. The lobby and rooms were beautiful. The only thing I didn't love was the location. It is at least 6 blocks from the subway, and Michigan ave busses. After doing a 4 hour walking tour of the city, I didn't like having to walk over 1/2 a mile back to the hotel. Otherwise a great hotel. Also, I think I fell in love with the doormen there! input_doc:
This was my first time at an Embassy Suites hotel, and I have to say I liked it a lot! I usually stay at the courtyard marriotts, but this was lovely. There was a two-room suite, FREE DRINKS and SNACKS from 5-7 at the bar, and breakfast was included in the price!
I was going for a convention, and so it was only a 2 block walk from the washington convention center. 5 minutes walk to chinatown. Free internet in the lobby.
The bed was SOOOO comfy.
The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel was that the soap was dry. Bring your own soap.
I would definitely stay here again.

input_doc:
Very good location close to the Seaport conference center. its a 5 min walk, which is lovely (if the weather is good). the hotel seems new, everything is in good shape with a lovely reception sitting area with free wifi. Breakfast was great, but there is also a Starbucks inside the lobby..
Got a room with a poor view, but asked for a change, got the top floor 16 with seaport view, that was very nice. I liked very much their guided outdoor morning run, although I didn't get a chance to try it, maybe next time.
 I usually buy on amazon my stuff before I arrive, and have it delivered to the hotel, I was surprised to find they transfer it to the business center who charges per box!!!! Disappointed by that, and that its not clear in advance.. but the reception manager sorted it out for me this time..

input_doc: Stayed for 2 nights 24/25th January 2008 No problem with location bus stop opposite hotel and tube station close by, room clean comfortable bed , good shower, no view from room so kept blind closed, after all you do not go to NY to spend time in your room. Took local bus back to hotel arrrived back at room about 10.30 pm -5 degrees outside about same in room no heating on, went to bed very tired, only to wakened at 4.30 am with pipes banging and clanking till 6.30 am when heating went off again and I mean loud sleep was impossible. input_doc: This is THE most disgusting place I have ever stayed at in my life. Not only did the place stink..I had to put sheets on top of the comforter and sleep under my coat! The only people who should stay here are the ones that were there anyway...the local crack heads. I checked out at 7 in the morning and checked in down the road at the Doubletree. NEVER EVER EVER spend your money at this place...it is horrible!!!!

Stopped for one night having arrived in to Boston just before midnight on a late flight. The handy link walkway to the hotel is misleading although it does have one if you happen to be in the right
terminal. We probably dragged our suitcases a couple of miles around the airport and car park. It would have been easier to just get a taxi outside the terminal to the front door of the hotel.
Then to find that the room we had booked had been given out because we had arrived late...........no suprise there we told them on our booking request, we just felt that the staff didnt care whether we stopped or not.
A handy stop over but I could'nt recommend it for anything more than an evening.

input_doc:
I've stayed lots of places in NYC, and this is probably one of the worst. It's not dangerous, dirty, or trashed, but it's also not nice.
The main complaint is noise - it doesn't have double paned windows, and the street noise is out of control, even in my 15th floor room. A smaller complain is the suuuuper sloooow lifts.
Amenities wise, there's a lobby bar/restaurant. Didn't try them - this is NYC. There's also a pool, but I was there in October.
The location is OK - it's a long but manageable walk to times square, and not too far to a metro stop.
I would look for a deal at the hilton times square, or stay at the Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers, which is a bit rough also but has a much better location and isn't much more expensive.

input_doc: This will be my third time staying in a Kimpton Hotel. My children ages 13 & 15 had never been to San Francisco so for a mini weekend getaway before school starts back we drove up from Los Angeles. The Prescott is 2 short blocks away from Union Square in the Heart of San Francisco and a few blocks from the Powell St/Hyde Cable Car, and of course wonderful shopping. We had a BLAST!! We stayed in a Junior Suite, arrived late Friday night and were so pleased to have the beds turned down with a welcome note and chocolates on the beds. The hotel is beautifully boutique in style and size and has lovely contemporary/classic furnishings throughout. Beds are incredibly cozy, (kids said even the pull out bed was comfortable), complimentary continental breakfast for Club Level members was nice on the 4th floor, and the staff is sooooooo nice and knowledgable. What I love is that it is close to everything. I have never had a bad stay at a Kimpton Hotel and I highly recommend your next trip to one of their locations!! Keep in mind that if you are looking for large rooms, boutique hotels may not be for you, however the suites are very nice in size and comfort!

input_doc:
Ok, this review is a little late. 
We stayed in March during our trip for the Architectural Digest. I'm an SPG Gold member so I try to stay at SPG hotels as much as possible. I'm also a bit of a germ freak and was thrilled to find out the Chatwal was bed bug free!!! 
The rooms are old world 1920's styled. Yes, they are a tad dark, and yes the room control can be difficult at times. HOWEVER, the bathroom is excellent, the bed is inviting, and the embrace makes you want a dirty martini on the rocks.
The location is great as well. I would recommend this to those looking for excellent service, great location, and attention to detail.

input_doc: Our stay at this hotel was as travellers in transit heading to Syracuse. The staff went above and beyond to make our last night a memorable one. We opted to travel from Syracuse to Seattle as an affordable means to make it to Vancouver for the winter Olympics. The night we stayed at the hotel was the night of the Canada- USA hockey game (not the gold medal game but the first round game). We were able to watch the game with our family and the kids had a blast in the pool. When travelling in transit I am always frazzled trying to sort out the clothes, the tickets, what to keep on hand, etc. The staff made it very easy and with the helpful shuttle service added to our overall positive experience. In future we will consider doing the same trip in order to save on travel costs to Vancouver. As I mentioned in the title a great hotel if you are heading to Seatac, can't see it being a convenient spot if you want to visit Seattle from there. Thanks to the awesome staff!!!!

input_doc:
I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn and although the staff was very nice and tried to help me in different situations. The management at the hotel is poor and looks like nothing is done to upgrade this hotel. The rooms are sooooo small that you can't move around in them. The bathtub is too small for a child. The elevator is slow, the breakfast embarassing and just to far away from the thick of things.
It is in a residental area and you don't even feel like you are in NY......They are other properties in the city that you can find that you will be much happier with

Ok...I could never afford to stay here on my own but was put up by my company for a quick business trip and I couldn't have been happier.
The modern design of this hotel is pure sexiness to the nth degree. A superb example of minimalism with lots of white space. And the bed was sooo comfortable!
The staff couldn't have been nicer (and hell, for almost $500 bucks a night they should treat you like a king). 
The location is pure downtown with great shopping in walking distance. Unfortunately I didn't get to explore but I hope that on my next trip I get the opportunity to stay at this hotel again.
(PS: Be sure to check out what the minibar has to offer beyond the booze...too funny).

input_doc: My husband and I visited NYC for the first time and stayed at the Bryant - we only did our research online and did not know what to expect. We were thrilled with our choice and will definitely stay here again if we are ever lucky enought o return. The location is wonderful - just two blocks away from Time Square which is great - can get there in 5 minutes or less (walk) but it is far enough away that it is quiet and away from all the chaos. The staff were all very helpful, friendly and extremely professional. The rooms were surprisingly spacious and the amenities were great - love the turn down service! Highly recommend this hotel!!!!!

The final integration ensures a balance of aspects represented by their contextual significance and strength of sentiment across different model perspectives.

input_doc: A large Hilton in the downtown San Jose area. Very convenient location if you have business in the downtown area. Only drawpack is parking...either valet it, or pay the $10 or so a day to use self-park with in/out privileges. Using self-park means you'll have a LOOOOOONG walk back to your room.

Stayed here with my wife and son for 3 nights over a weekend! This was the best hotel i stayed at in the month i was in the states. We had a room that looked over 6th street, yes 6th street can get loud..... but its austin!!!!! if you want to stay somewhere quite stay in san antonio. The room was clean and the bathroom was very nice. The hotel staff were outstanding! If i ever get the chance to go to this great city again i will be staying at the OMNI!

input_doc:
If you're looking for a great, new hotel on a great location in NY, Fashion 26 is the place to be!!!! Conveniently located near the Empire State Building, the Flat Iron district, Soho, Penn Station and Times Square: this is it.... It's a brandnew hotel, great, modern and nicely designed rooms with lots of extra's, great bathroom, super bed and spectacular views....
We loved it and we spent 6 nights in June...
The staff is most helpful and kind and we loooooved it!
If we go back for a trip to the Big Apple, we'll most certainly try to book there again!
Thank you again for a home away from home, Fashion 26, we love you !!!!Christel&Rudi

input_doc: From the moment you are greeted at the front door by the very handsome Ambassadors, to the very personable Front Desk Agents, friendly Houskeeping, etc, this has to be the BEST HOTEL in NEW YORK CITY. I have stayed at Ritz Carlton Hotels before and I can honestly say that the St. Giles Tuscany is on par with and at times surpasses the service that is provided. If you are coming to New York City and you need a place to stay, the St. Giles Tuscany is your hotel!!! 5 STARS

We stayed for 3 nights over easter, picked hotel mainly due to location as have done midtown and wanted something a bit different. 
Location was great could walk to greenwich, soho, little italy etc all very easily from hotel.
Hotel itself was very modern, room was small but you are in New York. Bed was sooo comfy, big shower, great view, housekeeping were very good as well. 
Bar was quite small but staff nice and friendly and drinks generous. Would definately stay here again.

The "heavenly" bed was a disaster! The prices were such that you would expect sooooo much more! The hot tub scalded the guests. The teenagers were highly bored and that made our life more difficult. The quality of the food was not what you would expect for the price. I would not go back or recommend this hotel chain after this experience. I was not impressed except for the helpful, friendly staff...who were working for their tip of course.

input_doc: I loved this hotel!!!! The decorations and the pool are amazing! The maid service was great I always had a clean room. The rooms were clean and cozy the beds were soft and comfortable. It was easy to fall asleep. At night there are no loud disturbing noises so you can sleep. Has everything you need, a laundry mat, a small store for food (even has internet access), I always recommend to friends and family who are coming into town on a budget. input_doc: Stayed at the La Quinta Inn & Suites in early October, we were taking a mini vacay from Vancouver, BC ... our party had 2 rooms( 4 of us) - they were fantastic! Nice and roomy-very clean - and the beds were soooooo comfy! We found everyone at the front desk and all staff to be so nice and very helpful- we also really enjoyed the breakfast ! Couldnt have picked a better place to stay ! We are planning a trip to Seattle again in May , my 4 daughters and I will be staying here again ! Thanks again La Quinta !

input_doc:
I booked this hotel through Expedia.it for an average of 100 $ a night and it's awesome!!! I mean it's not a luxury hotel, but spotless clean, in front of the Rockefeller center, near to the theater district, you have complimantary internet access and desktop at the mezzanine floor. For that price in NY I think it's really a great choice. 
Could be better: the reception is small and nearly always overcrowded, but they quickly attend your needs anyway, The desktop they provide id only one, but generally nobody is there (plus they provide a printer). The rooms are not big (they have mostly queen beds I think) but they have LCD TVs and anything you may need. 
If you are on the lowest floors it can be a little noisy, but if you get a room with a view on the inner yard, it is ok.

input_doc:
The hotel was renovated recently, so the room was almost brand new. The staff was very friendly and helped me with some sightseeing possibilites. Pool and jacuzzi were good, but we kept telling them no towels were out there. They were very prompt in getting more towels. 
The beds were really comfortable and if I can figure out how to get a shower like that, I am definately doing it!!!! Having a refrigerator and microwave was a big help.

I am a businessman from Hong Kong and I do a lot of travel in my work.
In March, I had to make a trip to New York and I wanted to bring my family with me. My colleague recommended the Buckingham Hotel. They took time to understand my needs and offer me a reasonable rate. 
This is an outstanding hotel in the best location. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite and it was more spacious than most apartments in Hong Kong. We loved it. And the staff was sooo helpful and recommended restaurants 
for us that were quite delicious. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and I will stay here again on my next trip !

input_doc:
my boyfriend and i stayed at the affinia dumont for 5 nights at the end of march, we picked this hotel on the strength of the top reviews on tripadvisor. 
we requested a room on a high floor and were rewarded with amaaaazing veiws of the city, with the chrysler building right in front of us. we were given such a massive room which even had a seperate lounge/office area which was great to come back to after a tiring day of shopping!
the location was perfect, within walking distance to the empire state, times square etc and the taxis are cheap enough for when you can't walk anymore!
the affinia was very clean, the staff were very polite and helpful and the barking dog next door is really good too. overall exceptional value for money.
i would reccommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to new york.

input_doc: Me and my husband decided to take a last minute New Year's Eve Trip to Charlotte. I booked the hotel through Hotwire. When I saw where we were staying and I read the reviews here, I knew we were in trouble. I went anyway with the hope that maybe we got a bigger room and that maybe the walls wouldn't be so thin. Well, my hopes went unanswered because the room we had was sooooooo tiny that me and my husband could barely fit with our one suitcase. We were expecting to hear noise in the hall because it was New Year's Eve but the noise we heard ALL NIGHT long was from our neighbor and her lover. It was awarkard and we got no sleep. Please take my advice and don't let the name "Crowne Plaza" fool you; stay away from this hotel. It is not even worth the discounted price you get from hotwire just add $30 or $40 more and stay somewhere else.

input_doc: We have stayed 5 times at Newbury Guesthouse because the location is so good and the breakfast USED TO BE wonderful. input_doc:
Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 5 days this February. The hotel is in a great area and is very close to the local shops, restaurants and other facilities. 
The hotel is pretty new and therefore is in an excellent condition. The room was excellent and the bed very comfortable. All the usual extras were included such as microwave, fridge, coffeee machine etc.
The staff were all very friendly and helpful and this added to the overall experience.
The hotel is about a 30/40 minute drive from the centre of SanDiego but you can drive 20 minutes to the fashion valley mall and catch the metro into town. The parking is free and the fare is $2 - $4 dollars (return) depending on your destination.

input_doc:
Arrived in NY for the first time 6/2/04 for four nights and was looking forward to a great stay. I can say that NY was fantastic , but it's a same i can't say the same about the hotel Wolcott. Our room was on floor 8 and as soon as you managed to cram into the tiny lift and slowly make your way up (half an hour later), the doors open on to the most horrendous smell, so bad that it made you heave. Our room was so small and dingy, no natural light and the water pressure in the shower swung from freezing cold to scorching hot, the heating systems (i think) kept you awake half of the time and the heat in the room was unbearable, to say that we sleep with the window open and no radiators on!!! TThe hotel did provide clean bed linen and the towels were alway changed, which was a bonus. When the Tv didn't work we contact the reception desk to be greeted with very unpleasant staff, maybe the Wolcott could be given some training on customer service skills, this wouldn't go a miss.
All in all the Wolcott is a very cheap and cheerful hotel and as long as you ensure you are absolutely knackered and all you want is sleep then you could just about cope with this hotel. PS take a peg for your noise just incase your on floor eight!!!

input_doc: We travel to Seattle 4 times a year and usually stay at the Hyatt Grand. It's true that the Westin isn't as posh as the Hyatt Grand, in terms of interior design but we loved it anyway. What made it exceptional was the accomodating staff. Particulary the front desk clerk Hillary who sent chocolate fondue with strawberries up to my daughter for her 13 birthday. We had an great view from our room, everything was clean and functioned well, the pool was a treat and the location couldn't be better. The beds were luxurious. We have no complaints and we now prefer the Westin to the Hyatt Grand. It's the people!!!

input_doc:
I had no idea what to expect of the Biltmore but my god, did it go above and beyond my expectations. The building is simply stunning and is rich with old Hollywood history, this is where the Oscars started after all! The staff were incredible, the in house restaurants were great, the beds were comfy and the rooms clean. 
I have no idea why it doesn't sit on par with the Chateau Marmont, perhaps it's because of the slightly seedy downtown area, the Marmont is beautiful but having spent time in a couple of different rooms there they are really nothing too spectacular and very similar to some of the old apartment buildings in Hollywood.
Although downtown LA is still up and coming it really is getting there, just walk a block and a half from the Biltmore to Bottega Louie a fairly new upscale deli, restaurant and market, not only can you enjoy the food but it'll give you a glimpse of just where downtown is heading.
The only downfall- PARKING $45 a night!!! I beleive this is due to the fact they have very few parking spaces and don't actually want you to park there. There is a parking structure across the street for just $5 though.

We stayed here on Thanksgiving night. Granted, the hotel was probably not even half full, so we got great service. The guy at the front desk upgraded our two rooms to end rooms. These rooms were HUGE!!! They were basically two rooms combined. They had two tv's, a couch, large desk. It was awesome. The rooms were decorated very nice and the beds were actually comfortable. This is a must stay if going downtown. Only negative was the price for parking $18, which is standard anywhere downtown.

input_doc: We got a VERY good deal for a room at this time of year. Our room was EXCELLENT, the hotel was EXCELLENT, the breakfast was EXCELLENT, location was EXCELLENT, view was EXCELLENT (Empire State building view). We felt safe in our room, did not see any rats, roaches, or ANY bedbugs. The room was very clean, and we had plenty of soap, towels, shampoo, and lotion. We got free complimentary breakfast (choice of orange juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, bagels, tea, buttered rolls, muffins). There is a fitness room, free Post and USA newspapers each day we were there. I WAS VERY SURPRISED STAYING IN NEW YORK AT A GOOD HOTEL FOR SUCH A GOOD PRICE!!!!!

My partner and I stayed at this hotel in Febuary 2007 for 2 nights. The hotel itself looks very grand inside and our room was of adequate size for the two of us. The shower wasn't as expected for a Marriott but it did the job after a long trip from the UK but the bed had to be the BEST bed I had ever slept in! Verrry cosy!
The staff were always helpful to answer any questions / give you directions. My only little moan would be waiting for the Hertz office to open inside the hotel. We waited for 45 mins after opening time!

input_doc:
WOW! Where shall I begin? Upon arrival the front desk staff was quite knowledgeable and welcomed us with a smile. Nikki then informed us of all the free amenities the hotel provided such wireless internet, breakfast and 24 hour coffee service, to name a few, I was very impressed. 
The room was clean and the note on the bed let us know the duvet was washed just for us, but not just for us, they are washed for EVERY new guest at Hampton every time. Hampton really takes the mystery out of shopping for a hotel. They are well located in many markets, their quality is consistent and the surroundings are comfortable and welcoming. Well done Hampton Inn & Suites Memphis  Beale Street! Five Stars!!!

input_doc:
The Felix has only been open a short time and sadly the restaurant was behind schedule so we had to eat out. It also meant that only tea and coffeee were available in the mornings.That said however the hotel is well situated for access to the city and there are plenty of eating places within easy walking distance. Would suggest YOLK on Wells for excellent breakfasts. Rooms in the hotel were perfectly adequate, comfortable and well air conditioned. Staff were friendly and helpful and the bar, though small, was no bad place to come back to at the end of the day. In all, we spent ten days there and were we to visit Chicago again would certainly not bypass The Phoenix.
Dennis Johnston

I have no idea why the rating on this hotel is 4 stars. It is dirty, run down and the service is terrible. The rooms look like they have not been redecorated in about 15 years, the check in staff (Seahn, namely) is SOOOOO rude, and the breakfast waiter we had was awful. The food was cold and not very tasty. We were very disappointed, as this was an anticipated trip that was ruined. Do not waste your time at this place.

input_doc: This hotel, as is with MO. . . was absolutely gorgeous. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The room was fabulous. You certainly "spoil" yourself when staying at an MO. The pool was nice and I couldn't help noticing the spa on the way to the pool. It is a short walk to Independence Mall and there is a Starbuck's right across the street. . . who could ask for anything more?????

Great hotel!!! The whole staff was great throughout my stay. Alfonso at the bar was great!! He has the perfect touch for "stiff drinks". Javier, the night manager, was courteous and attentive. I had an issue during the night with my ac and he was so kind to not only send the engineer, but a fan was delivered by Javier. Javier invited us for breakfast, which we sadly had to decline due to previous engagements. San Antonio was great, the Hyatt was memorable. I will definately be making plans to come back before summer ends. Thank you!!

input_doc:
I can't believe that I waited so long to give this jewel of a property a try. I stay in Dallas about 4 to 8 nights a month and have stayed at all of the so called "4 and 5 diamond" properties. None of them in this area (Dallas/Ft. Worth) can touch the service, the ambience or the location of this property. Trust me when I say to all that this is a must try. Once you stay there, I believe you will be hooked. Not only did I feel like a star when I entered the lobby, but I actually saw several current movie and TV stars having a drink in their wonderful lounge. 
The Melrose Hotel has given me a bunch more reasons to stay in Dallas as much as I can. 
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you for the wonderful experience!!!!!!!

input_doc:
I loved the room the bed was soooooo comfortable the location was Right the view was nice...only downfall was I booked this room using my Hilton Points...everyone at front desk was very helpful and polite...however when I called down later in the night to inquire of my email password I was told I was only a silver and only Diamond members get free internet...I also injuired about breakfast not asking for free and she was quick to tell me my STATUS didnt allow me free breakfast....( I was just trying to find out where the resturat was ) needless to say I took my unstatused self down to the local resturant and ordered $25.00 of breakfast (plus a hefty tip) needless to say Never assume....(maybe there should be some retraining in this area)
I wonder if I had not been staying with points would I have been treated as a more valued guest??
I would love to give this hotel a better rating however the few tings that rubbed me the wrong way.

input_doc: My husband was attending a business seminar. I went along to attend my class reunion. After dragging in in the middle of the night with a craving for chocolate milk, the concierge handed me hot chocolate chip cookies AND went and found milk for me! The staff definitely went above and beyond. The room was very clean; decor was upscale; and the bedding was soooo comfy! I have nothing but compliments :)

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni Hotel California Plaza from 12/30/2011-1/2/2012, in addition to us celebrating the New Year, the 30th was his Birthday. We checked in late Friday evening after a long flight from Connecticut, we were greeted with excellent customer service, upgraded to a Premier Room upon check-in and a complementary glass of white wine after the front desk staff that assisted us saw how exhausted we were! As a woman who is finicky about everything imaginable, I was sooooo pleased with the cleanliness of this Hotel, the plastic that was placed daily on the wine glasses and drinking classes, I didn't feel like I had to wear shower shoes in the stand alone shower, which is huge for me, the bathroom excellent size, only drawback ladies not enough counter space. Room service was excellent, I have to say we experienced none of the issues the patron did with breakfast trays being left in the hallway, we ordered room service Saturday Night left the tray outside the door the next morning within the hour it was gone. I was impressed with the fitness Center, no issues there either, excellent equipment options, loved the basket of complementary brand new ear buds you could use, however I brought my own. I am back and forth from home to LA at least 3 times a year, so I agree Downtown LA isn't the best place for Restaurant options, I mean come on your in LA, venture out, We dined at Katana's Friday evening, we tried to make it to Fogo de Chao Saturday but had to get ready for New Years Eve Party, so ended up eating at the Grove, Sunday it was Bossanova excellent Brazilian food. Near by the Omni there is an Ice-skating ring and many areas to walk around to see during the DAY or early evening of Downtown LA. Last I am a Starbucks fanatic and when I attempted to grab a caffine jolt before my evening began Saturday I was told by the worker at the cafe' located in the hotel on the 2nd floor that the machines were being cleaned, they were suppose to close at 8pm, it was 7:40pm needless to say I was not a happy camper.

input_doc:
I don't usually write reviews for the hotels I stay in, but this Omni Hotel provided outstanding service!!!! One morning I accidently dropped my necklace down the sink drain, and John, the friendly Engineer on duty, quickly came to our room and within minutes retrieved my necklace. We were attending family reunion and they catered to our every need. Whenever we called the front desk they were so helpful. This was a beautiful hotel and exceptional service. Thanks for a great stay Omni!!!!
P.S. The only thing we would change is the sliding bathroom door. Not as much privacy.

input_doc:
This is a very nice hotel located in an area we didn't know so well.
The staff was excellent, we got an extra bed for our 10yo daughter free of charge.
Check out the bar's furniture.
Excellent breakfast in a lovely dining area that becomes a dinner place for hotel guests and non- in the evening.
The rooms aren't too big but they are excellently appointed and the madrass is just sooo confortable. Shower was very good too.
Come here if this is your first time in New York or if you want to discover a new side of the Big Apple. Very near to Subway and When Harry Met Sally's famour Jewish restaurant.
We strongly recommend this hotel for your future stays.

input_doc:
This is not your hotel if you want luxury treatment and endless amenities. But if you want something unique with a taste of rock'n'roll, there is no better place!!! A stay at the Chelsea is a MUST!
Okay, $200 plus tax for a shared bathroom is maybe not very cheap, but the Chelsea experience weighs it all off. Lots of art in the building, great people, superb and friendly staff, a room that just rocks - honestly, no need to complain about having to cross the hall for a shower.
I stayed at the Chelsea for one night after a week of business meetings and have to say: Chelsea Hotel rocks!

My husband & I travel frequently, and I can say without a doubt, this is my favorite hotel of what I would call the "urban category". My husband had a conference here last year, so I tagged along for the adventure. I went shopping during the day while he slaved away at the conference. The hotel is conveniently located 1-2 blocks away from the pedestrian-friendly "shopper's paradise". Denver has this cool street completely closed to traffic, except for buses that you can ride for free, & it's nothing but shops, bars, & restaurants.
The service at the hotel was wonderful - it was truly a 5 star experience! The rooms couldn't be any cuter or more comfortable.
This hotel is highly recommended!!!
