input_doc: ICK!!! This place is old and stinky. Certainly nowhere close to standards I am accustomed to from Marriott. On the plus side...beautiful view of city hall from our room. Back to the negative...verrrrrrrry small bathroom; smell from neighbor's cooking lingering in the hallway; small bed (full not queen).

As my husband and I were checking in to our Hotel Carlton, someone commented on the flowers I had by asking if we were celebrating a special occasion. I said,"Yes, we were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary." They said,"Congratulations!" 
 When we returned to our room later that evening, the staff had made a heart our of fresh rose petals on our bed and in the middle had placed a bottle of wine, 2 wine glasses, a corkscrew and a box with a generous piece of delicious lemon cake. SOOOO sweet of them!
 Our whole stay was like that. Everyone was friendly, helpful, and funny. We loved our room, the decorations, and the cleanliness. Would stay there again.
John & Sharon Vaughan
Oklahoma City
July 2007

input_doc:
My friends decided to take me to Austin for my 60th birthday celebration. We love to stay at Embassy Suites when possible. We stopped at this Austin Embassy and had the great fortune of dealing with their hostess, Tanya. She made our check-in a breeze, gave us bottled water and then later that night when we came back to our room, we found beautiful chocolate covered strawberries. What a surprise and what service!!!!!! She was so kind and helpful and made this trip wonderful. Thanks - Tanya
Our room was quiet, very clean and all in working order. This is what we have come to expect from this hotel chain. When you get this kind of special service, a great breakfast and a free cocktail hour - it's the best deal going.

input_doc: I nve actually stayed at the hotel. I did make a reservation which I cancelled due to plans to go to Atlantic city instead. I was later billed by the hotel for the room and was told that someone had in fact stayed at the hotel in my room under my name and charged it to my credit card. Hmmm, who would have my name , credit card # and exp. date except for a hotel employee? I have tried to settle this w/ the hotel but have been ignored and my credit card company is in the process of disputing the charge. WARNING: there are obviously some scam artists working here- be careful!

We just got back last weekend. We were looking for budget and found this wonderfully clean, centrally located hotel. And rumors about the front desk were untrue. We booked through Travelocity (not-recommended) and LaQuinta crew helped us sort out Travelocity's mistakes!! The stories about old carpet are true, but the bathrooms are completely marbled and redone, the rooms are clean. Small yes, great value yes!!! Walking distance to everything and the sky bar gets a fabulous view of the Empire State Building, you're in the building's shadow! The hot/cold water pressure was variable, take your shower before 9am!, Otherwise, we were shockingly surprised by the price, clenliness and location, we'd definitely stay there again!!!

input_doc: My family and I had two rooms at the Hampton Inn at Madison Square Garden. We received a warm, 5-start welcome upon arrival from "John" at the front desk. The location, just a block from AMTRAK's Penn Station, and an easy walk to subway stations, is excellent. Our rooms were spotlessly clean, bright, and cheerful. The rooms are small, but they have everything a tourist needs, including freee wi-fi. All the employees we had contact with over the three day were were extremely helpful and friendly. They stored our luggage for us after check-out so we could sight-see until our late afternoon departure. The free breakfast is bountiful and fresh. We would definitely stay here again.

input_doc:
Wow! What a stay! My husband and I stayed here to be able to celebrate my birthday in town without driving. It was a few blocks further from the market area that I wanted, but well worth the extra steps. EVERYONE at 1000 was awesome, from valet to concierge to front desk where we had a glass of bubbles at check-in. They knew it was my birthday and the valet even brought me a red rose :)
The room was gorgeous and comfy. Like everyone else, we loved the bathtub (it's perfect for 2) and I could have stayed in it all night just drinking champagne and listening to the Mood channel.
I look forward for another reason to spend a special night at the Hotel.
Thank you!!!

This final consolidated analysis takes into account the agreement across agents while resolving minor differences in terms of sentiment intensity and the specific phrasing of opinion terms to reflect a thorough ABSA result.

input_doc: My husband planned a surprise trip to New York to celebrate my birthday and to help mark something off my Bucket List. The first part of the trip, we stayed at the Michelangelo for its convenience to the Gershwin Theater. The location is excellent. Our room was beautiful and SPACIOUS!!!! The towels were soooo soft and the bedding luxurious. I was disappointed in the coffee service but that's just my taste. Just plain croissants and no regular ole coffee. Also the maid turned the heat on when she cleaned the room which was probably an isolated incident. I plan to stay here on my return trip.

We just stayed here for one night for our anniversary and everything from valet to check in and breakfast in the room was awesome. Every year we stay downtown at a different hotel for our anniversary and this year we choose the pan pacific and I must say it ranks right up there as one of the best ever! They upgraded us at checkin to a corner king suite and wow what a gorgeous view of the space needle and peek a boo view of Lake Union. It was beautifully decorated, and the beds were sooo cozy! The walk uptown was simple and quick and we even walked back from dinner at 10:00 p.m. from 4th and university and it was very safe and fast. I would definetely recommend this to my friends or anyone visiting Seattle.

input_doc: I chose the Intercontinental Barclay to celebrate my birthday with family and friends. I was pleasantly surprised when I got upraded to a fabulous 2 bedroom suite. I do travel quite a bit and I must say this hotel is one of the tops on that list. They even went out of their way to replace the feather pillows due to my children's allergies. input_doc:
I stayed here on a 5 night trip to the Big Apple, and couldnt be happier. Great helpful staff members, a room up-grade was given without asking. Spotlessly clean. Modern tasteful rooms with a pillow menu!!! Great location - across the road from Maddison Square Gardens, 3 mins walk away from Penn Station, 5 minutes from Macy's and 10 minutes from Times Square. Could get loud outside noise - but what would you expect from the city that never sleeps. I would recommend a trip to Dunken Doughnuts (right outside) for a cheap and cheerful breakfast (porriage and breakfast muffins on the menu with coffee for under $5)
Would recommend and stay here again.

input_doc: Ahhh, what can we say about this hotel. We were staying here on a deal from a timeshare company, so I guess we shouldn't complain too loudly BUT since when did we want to subscribe to 24 hour broadcasting of other guests' lives? We could hear everything from the rooms on either side of us and could understand their conversations. We had a mother and kids on one side, laughing up a storm and music videos followed by business telephone conversations on the other. we're sure they could hear us too, which leaves something to be desired, we're sure. They have a great location, but need to invest in some soundproofing before we would stay there again. The restaurant had good food, but was understaffed. Other than the soundproofing issue, we found them clean and comfortable. We would however, not stay here again unless it was free or close to it! Definitely not up to Best Westerns' standards.

input_doc:
Returned to NYC and decided to stay in the New Yorker again after reading it had been refurbished. Rooms are VERY small but space is at a premium here! They haven't totally refurbished the rooms, just updated them. The Tick Tock diner underneath the hotel is 24 hours and great!
Ideally located next to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, a few blocks from Times Square, Empire State and Macy's.
Highlights this time were:
1) Walked across the Brooklyn bridge (great people watching!)
2) Eat at Lombardi's pizza in Little Italy... arrive hungry!
3) Wandered round Greenwich Village and eat at Magnolia bakery
4) Walked round most of Central Park in the sun
Although tough on your feet, I advise to walk everywhere as there is soooo much to take in!

input_doc: Great value for the money......free breakfasts.....pleasant checkin/out Highly recommend for families. Super location

We have just been on our honeymoon to new york and were sooo pleased with the Casablanca. From the minute we arrived, we experienced the best in US hospitality, The room was nice, clean and functional. The main thing about the room was that we were only about 10 metres from Times Square but it was so quiet and we had great nights sleep. Reception staff were great as were the staff in Rick's Cafe were we took full advantage of cheese and wine early evening. Really lovely and civilised and other clientelle were very nice too.
If you want a clean, central hotel with great staff and good food, this is for you!

input_doc: I had to go to Houston for school and I stayed here for 8 days it has a real breakfast. The staff is really nice the rooms are big the price is nice. I was sooooo comfortable there.I be will back next month. it's close to highway so going to kemah boardwalk was easy! this hotel was a pleasant surprise.

on a pass 5 nuits dans cet hotel, l'acceuil est sympatique, le personel serviable. notre chambre etait au 8 eme etage ce qui nous donn une vu agrable, et nous etions plutot au calme, cela dit notre chambre ne donner pas sur la rue... Le chauffage est un peu bruyant mais apparement s'est souvent la cas dans les hotels au USA. La literie est confortable.
le metro est a cinq minutes a pied de l'hotel, le quartier est sympa.
nous avons pass un tres bon sjours dans cet hotel!!!

As A college student I live at the Belnord. My room is 9ft x 8ft. The hotel staff is nasty and the rooms are dark and drab. The hotel has a bedbug issue and dosent seem to know how to fix it so students, as well as hotel guests are being bit by little bugs. The basment has many roaches, wich is not uncommon for new york but it is still discusting. I cant tell you how many times I have been in the lobby of the hotel and watched the front desk managers loose someones reservations, book them for the wrong nights, and just over book the hotel in general leaving many people without a hotel room. I strongly suggest you continue your search for hotels in NYC!!!

input_doc:
We stayed at Stay Hotel last week and had a fabulous time in New York! The hotel staff are very friendly and couldn't off been any more attentive! Let's make one thing very clear to everyone reading this review, THE LIFT's are not slow! and the rooms sizes are a good size! Ignore any other review that mentions the above not being so great ! As a lot of hotels theses days the lobby is well design as the bar/club but as soon as you go into a room it's complete different world. They tried to put some "design" into the room but you feel right away that it's just fake. So no isolation between rooms, I could ear clearly what my neighbour was doing and I had to change room at midnight because the music was too lowed... 4 stars??? 
And I am not finished, I had too pay an extra fee to hold an extra shopping bag with my luggage, come on!! Seriously could we stop this "fake" hotel trend! Lucky we have Trip Advisor to help us to avoid these places. input_doc: That's the best way to describe this hotel. You're fooled by the lobby into thinking you've just checked yourself into a pretty decent hotel. Well, I'm here to tell you to run. Run fast. But not down the loooong hallways that lead to the rooms which are reminiscent of bad 1980's horror films - complete with the faded orange paisley-ish carpet and all. Once we reached our room the horror show didn't end, unfortunately. The curtains, crumbling walls, dirty ironing board, paper thin walls, falling-apart bar, and poorly renovated shower worked in unison to give us the authentic feeling of being in the horror film we didn't sign up for. Check-in at your own risk...

input_doc:
I stayed at the W in mid October. First time in the Big Apple, I couldn't of asked for a better hotel.
It was chic, trendy, upbeat, the best hotel I've stayed at anywhere by far! Very boutique and very sophisticated, good-looking people everywhere and definitley the place to be! Cool decor and VERY informative, well dressed concierge staff!
I personally enjoy a more boutique like property with a party scene and if you do, this is the place to be. I stayed at the Marriott down the street my last night and was not impressed, not compared the the W Times Square. Rooms were funky and oooh so comfortable and the spa was great!

Overall, the conclusion synthesizes and reconciles the differences and agreements from the three agents, resulting in a coherent Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis.

input_doc: I initially signed up to only stay one night in the Penthouse to host a social gathering for about 35 to 50 people, but after one night there I extended my stay for another 2 nights. The penthouse has everything you could ever need. The staff was extremely helpful and thoughtful. We are now committed to coming at least once a year to stay with our new family at the Joule. input_doc: My partner and I stayed here for two nights in mid-August and had the greatest time ever!!! Aside from the hotel's main selling point - its location - this hotel has so many things to offer. As Preferred Guests, we were booked into the new Union Tower, on the 24th floor, in a room with one King and a city room. The space was clean, quiet, beautifully decorated and well ventilated. The pool and recreation centre in the Pike Tower were also clean and easy to access. The restaurants downstairs served average food at a relatively reasonable price, but given your proximity to other venues, it would be advisable to eat elsewhere. Try the Tap House (with 160 different beers on tap and good food to boot) or the Cheesecake Factory, both of which are only a block away. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

input_doc: Every time I stay overnight in the Big Apple, I stay at the Muse. The location can't be beat (one block from Times Square and most Broadway theatres, a stone's throw from 5th Avenue shopping & Grand Central Station, in the heart of everything). The staff is always incredibly helpful and friendly. And the #1 perk: It's bedbug free!!! The linens are soft & the beds are super comfy. The rooms come with lots of fluffy pillows (without having to ask for extras). Yes, the rooms are a little on the small side and kind of pricey, but you have to expect that when you're in NYC. This is my favorite hotel - not just in NYC, but anywhere in the US!

**Rationale for Consolidation:**

- **Aspect Term:** The term "hotel" was used instead of "Muse" or "favorite hotel" for clarity and consistency, but with the added context that the user declares it as their favorite hotel across locations, which is captured in the opinion term.
  
- **Sentiment Polarity & Intensity:** Generally took the most prominent or agreed-upon classification between agents. Positive aspects with consistently strong sentiment scores (4) across all agents were acknowledged, while varying opinions on the "rooms" aspect regarding size and cost were settled on a slight negative sentiment with confirmation by two agents.

- **Opinion Terms:** Aggregated from all agents for comprehensive coverage of sentiment expressions while ensuring less than five words per term when broken down.

- **Category:** Consistently used categories that were agreed upon by at least two agents; changes were made where clearly specified terms suggested a certain classification, maintaining alignment with predefined categories.

input_doc: I was at the end of a 6 week holiday which included camping in Alaska and wanted to spoil myself. Even though I have plenty of friends to stay with in NYC, I wanted to try an old world, luxury NYC hotel. I picked the Pierre because it had been recommended by friends, plus I got an excellent deal. Although reviews on Trip Advisor were varied, I was sure I would love it, and I did. It was absolutely fantastic. I felt relaxed, pampered, and ooooh the bed was just divine. The hotel itself is beautiful. Be sure to have cocktails in the Rotunda (i think thats what its called) in the evening. An excellent way to end a hectic holiday!

As for the staff, they were absolutely wonderful and a delight from morning to night. The only thing I would recommend is, don't get a room next to the elevator as it might tend to get a little noisy at night when people are coming back. input_doc: This was my first trip to Denver from the East Coast and thanks to the Doubletree Denver my perception of Denver as a whole was excellent! Everyone we came into contact with at the hotel, from the Front Desk Agent to the Guest Service Manager, were all friendly and informative. The hotel itself was very well kept. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and of course the warm cookie upon check-in was a wonderful welcome after a long day of travel. In terms of location if you are looking to be closer to Downtown Denver or to the airport this might not be the hotel for you. You have to take a bus and then a metro into Denver proper. However, the public transportation in Denver is really great, so if you did decide to choose this hotel you are still pretty accessible to all the awesome things the city has to offer....and Denver is great. I would definitely stay here again!

input_doc: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this hotel when we were dropping off my daughter at college (just two blocks away). This hotel is beautiful - the rooms are very nice, the beds are extremely comfortable. The staff was very accommodating - our room looked out over the back and was sooooo quiet.... It's not a huge room but a good size for New York (and keep in mind that we had five huge pieces of luggage in the room which did not get into our way at all!). The hotel is an easy walk to Times Square, but it is about 8 blocks away or so. Breakfast was great - we just had an excellent experience here. It is not the cheapest, but you could pay a whole lot more for less also. We would definitely stay here again!

input_doc:
My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for a company Christmas party the weekend before christmas. Although it was quite packed because they had all of us from the company and a football team who was playing the colts the next day plus all their fans.I thought the elevators were slow but they had signs apologizing for that and they stated all the elevators were not working due to them updating them to suite their hotel better.I would definitely stay at the hyatt again. The rooms were nice and clean. I had no problems with the heat or the rooms being dirty or anything else.The only complaint i did have was the hotel not being blocked off from the mall. At the begining of the night we got hear the gaurds yelling at kids whos parents obviously were not watching them like they should be.
Which is in turn not the hotels but the parents fault !! I did enjoy the Hyatt and will definetly go back!!!

input_doc: Stayed at the Palace as first base on california tour trip with husband and 3 kids- 15, 12 +8yrs. Elegant gorgeous hotel. Great interconnecting rooms, beds sooo comfortable (best of whole trip), clean, well furnished good bathrooms etc Location was perfect- so glad we didn't stay at Fisherman's Wharf, this area much classier. Staff were really helpful but not intrusive. Restaurant excellent for breakfast and dinner- waitress really sweet especially to jet-laged kids (even when 8yr old fell asleep at the table!) Only negative point was the pool- surrounding tiles dangerously slippy. I fell badly getting out of pool and walking to a lounger - lucky to escape with horrible bruises. I thought it was me being clumsy but saw two other people slipping while I sat at the side- Very dangerous. Overall I would love to go back to the Palace and would reccommend it to anyone- even my vfussy mum!

input_doc:
From the moment you enter the lobby you know that this will not be an ordinary experience. I found the guest room to be well equipped for frequent travelers--plenty of electrical outlets on/near the desk AND the bed. Room well lit, but controllable to create a calming effect.
Bathroom is modern, in good working order with a really nice shower head (meant to check the brand/model so I could look for one for home!) and with plenty of vanity space to "spread out" all my 'stuff'.
Nice TV, but frustrating video menu/system--takes five minutes (a little exaggeration) each time you turn it on to get to regular broadcast stations. 
Small restaurant with a decent menu that is not irrationally priced like most chains. Staff was attentive, but at the same time saw that I was working while having lunch and did not seem upset at all that I occupied the table for over two hours! Meeting facilities are adequate--not luxurious but very functional.
This is a great litttle find when you are staying in downtown Houston.

input_doc: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hotel Monaco and it is now our go to place when we visit Chicago. I have stayed at several hotels in Chicago and have been in many others when friends would come to visit while I lived here. Hotel Monaco is by far the best. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. input_doc:
We stay at this hotel whenever we travel to Charlotte which is about 6 times a year since our son attends Johnson C. Smith University. This hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very spacious and the hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. On our most recent trip we were running super late for our reservation I called the hotel to let them know we would not make our check in time of 6pm which we were told was fine. When we arrived at 10:30pm we had already been checked into our room by the night manager and our room keys were waiting. All we had to do is sign our name!!! It was such a help after travelling so long.
I can not say enough nice things about the hotel. If there was any downside to the hotel it would probably be it's location. It's located in a business area so there aren't alot of places to eat within walking distance. Other than that it's perfect.

input_doc: I've stayed at many W hotels, I have always had non-smoking rooms. A week after my stay, I noticed a $150 charge on my bill so I called and inquired. They told me they smelled smoke so I must've been smoking in my room and I was charged for it. The hotel accountant told me "you must've been caught smoking", which wasn't the truth either. I'm not a smoker, never have been, and personally find it disgusting, but it's their word against mine now and they are getting $150 off me!!!! I'm furious about this and have disputed it with my credit card company. They can't make a quick buck off me like that, they already charge enough to stay there per night. Such a disappointment, check your bills after you checkout everyone!!!

Catch the trolley with jump on jump off access.

input_doc:
I wish I would have o
paid attention to guest reviews but booked a room in a hurry, thinking Radisson cant really be a bad choise!? The review from Singbe, makes sence now that I stayed at the hotel, the room was poorly cleaned and very chabby, full of mold which to me is severe due to an asthmatic condition. My healthcondition got even worse when I got home, since this stuff tends to stay with you for a couple of days. To top this they served me hair with my breakfast!!!! 
The hotel is lucky, I was in a hurry that morning and for that resdon didnt find the energy to argue for the little compensation they would have given me, some things money just cant fix. 
My advice, DONT GO THERE unless you are left with no other choise. I was staying there to avoid traffic-jam, between 16-17 july.

input_doc: I have just reurned from a 5 day trip to the Salisbury Hotel and would definately recommend it. There were 4 of us (all female) and on arrival were offered a suite with 2 adjoining rooms and 2 bathrooms - my Aunt slept on a sofa bed in the large living area which was very comfortable - there were 4 walk in closets , one with a safe. Breakfast was free every morning and was ample to set you up for the day. The roooms were very hot , probably because of the snow which we had for a few days. The only negative thing I would say about the hotel is that on arrival the girl behind reception was extremely unpleasant - I think her name was Carole (Young with long dark hair). She hardly made eye contact and when one of our party asked if she could use the rest room the key was banged down on the counter and without looking up , the girl just grunted "second floor"!! Despite this I would definately go back to the Salisbury. It is only 10 min walk to Times Square and even less to Central Park. Highly recommend Gray Line bus tour as welll as Olive Garden restaurant in Times SQ.

input_doc: I read lots of reviews before deciding to stay here and many mention that it is run down or that the neighborhood is kind of sketchy. I can see where people say it's run down as the carpets do seem to have that yesterday's look, but I thought it added to the nostalgia and found it inviting rather than a turn-off. As for the sketchy neighborhood, I also see why it was mentioned, however, we found it a very convenient location and not once did we feel unsafe. We took public transport the whole time we were there and even returned after midnight one evening. We were 4 people - 3 women and a 17 year old boy who were clearly tourists and not once did we feel uncomfortable in the neighborhood. It is well lit and we often saw officers about. The hotel itself is grand with beautiful common areas and a gorgeous pool/spa area. The beds were sooo soft and comfy, but firm for a beautiful night's sleep. I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and will stay there again if I ever return to LA. Speaking of downtown LA, it was clear to us that they've spent a lot of effort cleaning it up and it's really become a gorgeous city to explore so do yourself a favor and check it out while you're there, it no longer deserves a 'dumpy' reputation.

input_doc:
6 of us from rural Michigan checked in on the 21st of September. It started with John and his team at the door to greet us with smiles and welcomes (after our first Taxi ride which Iam sure came from Hell itself..).Then upstairs to Scott Kong at the desk...two of us girls sure gave him the run for his money with our questions of where to eat how to get there and whatever else we needed( some of which he had to answer 2 or 6 times and draw us pictures on the map).....but he kept right on the same page and was absolutley fantastic! And they stayed that way throuout our entire stay.
One of us had a craving for a muffin at 9 0clock at night...Scott went to the kitchen and emerged with 4 warm danishes MMmmmm thanks Scott you saved us from a lonnnnngggg night. John made sure we had a taxi to fit all of us and did NOT come from hell to get us back to the train. Thankyou sooo much for making our stay in Chicago rememberable......

input_doc: Friends recommended the Drury Inn & Suites and we are very pleased with our two nights' stay in June 2010. Great location, safe, pleasant stay, comfy bed! We were pleased with the price we paid and the value received. Only negative comment was on the breakfast and evening food. If you have children and want to "fill them up," then this is a good value for you. The quality is not good, i.e., "fake eggs" for example. Egg roll that I couldn't finish is another example. Just cheap, deep fried, tasteless food, but of course, you can eat instead at the many establishments along the river walk. I would definitely, positively recommend this hotel. Loved it!!!!!

input_doc: After reading the reviews from fellow travelers, my daughter and I decided to stay here while vacationing in San Diego. We loved this hotel!!! I used to live in San Diego and return as often as I can. This has become my new favorite place to stay in the San Diego area. input_doc: Stayed here two nights before catching a cruise. Location close to return a Hertz rental who then transported us to the terminal. Rooms are spotless, TV, fridge but no coffee maker, this was the room with jacuzzi which was sooo good after a hot day in the sun. Nearby there are a number of fastfood outlets within walking distance and a 7/11 5 mins away. By car there are other options for restaurants. Neighbourhood appears reasonable. Coffee is available in the mornings in the office. Manager very pleasant, although we had booked a room he allowed us to view others before we made our choice.

input_doc: We stayed at the St Regis this weekend on our starwood points. It was WONDERFUL. We requested either ajoining rooms or side by side rooms, since we were traveling with our three children. We were more than please to find rooms ajoined in a suite. The rooms were beautiful, butler service was excellent, and beds are soooo cozy. King Cole bar downstairs was also a lot of fun. Hotel is in a perfect location. We travel to NYC often and usually stay at the Four Seasons, but I think we will only stay at the St Regis now!!!

The staff at this hotel are amazing!!! My husband arrived July 22nd after a horrific car accident. I flew in the next day and stayed with him at this property. The 2 ladies mentioned below were sympathetic, helpful, and made us smile. Unfortunately I did not get any names but the desk clerk from Hawaii and the hotel manager are fantastic. input_doc: When travelling with my 9 year old son and the rest of my family, I make sure that all is clean, comfortable and worthy of the money spent. I must admit that I enjoyed staying at this hotel. The facility is very nice and every staff member was extremely helpful. The check-in process was great and the front desk staff were always accomodating. I had the riverfront balcony room and it was beautiful. The only thing was the parking, it didn't make me feel as if it was very secure. Upon another trip to Jacksonville, I would recommend staying at this hotel. At the pool area, there are more than enough chairs and plenty of towels. Great service, great location and great price. I would stay here again in a heart beat!!!

input_doc: I have stayed at Hotel 71 countless times and continue to be impressed by the amazing service, attention to detail, and the lengths employees go to here at the hotel to make sure their guests' needs and expectations are being exceeded! The staff here is absolutely amazing - from the front door to the managers, and everyone in between. They all care and it shows in the service they provide. Hotel 71 is a great place to stay when in Chicago! I've stayed at several other hotels in town, and none compare with the personalized approach taken here at Hotel 71 - they really know how to make you feel special and at home. Ask for a River View room - it's worth every penny!!! One of the best, if not the best, views in the city.

input_doc: so me & my gf got a great deal on this hotel, 3 blocks from central park, 2 blocks from the moma, you can even see times square down 7th, sounds great right? they fooled me!!! first they put me in room 443, the room was horrible!!!! 443 had the double bed as we had paid for, but the a/c was broken so there was a window a/c above it that rattled when it ran and it was sealed from the elements with duct tape!!! the tv in room 443 would only work with the remote, the buttons on the tv didnt work with it, the bathroom sink leaked non-stop, great views of an alley wall from what window we had with the window a/c there, outlets with no outlet covers (which violates building code), the room smelled, and it was an overall nightmare. I called the front desk and they connected me to jim, he was nice and had what he called "the best avail room for me" held for me after the guests in it checked out, it was room 1540, the room was nice, view of 7th ave, flat screen on the wall that worked, no window a/c, way better bathroom. the only problems in this room was that the blinds didnt work and we had to pull them down and use the iron to hold them down and everytime someone in an adjoining room would flush or shower you heard it, oh yeah the tub liked to leak in here too. overall the hotel was a place to sleep, would i got back probably not...

input_doc:
We really enjoyed staying here and were so happy with the wonderful service. The free mini bar snacks are great for when you need a little bite to eat. The continental breakfast is convenient, not the most amazing food, it's all pretty sugary stuff besides the fruit, but good to get you started for the day. The location is great, about 2 min walk from Hollywood highlands (the major tourist spots in Hollywood). The staff are always ready and more than happy to assist on any way. The bed was sooooo comfortable, we slept so well! The rooms are a little dated and sort of smell like an old apartment, but they are spacious and clean and that's what counts! there is also a kitchenette, although we didn't use that.

input_doc: I have stayed many times at this hotel and each time the rooms seem to get more run down. The hotel has renovated some of the rooms...but depending on when you check in and how crowded the hotel is....you will probably not see one of the better rooms. Even as a Platinum Hyatt Gold Passport member my last two stays here have now convinced me to move on to a different hotel when in Philadelphia. The carpet is worn, the curtains are frayed, the furniture looks like "good will" and the wallpaper is pealing. I was shocked that they had let the rooms in the wonderful and elegant hotel get so run down! Next time I shall try Marriott, Westin or something.........just not here until they have renovated all rooms.

input_doc:
Got a great deal here in December with AAA's "Free Breakfast" promotion. Check In was efficient and quick. Our 7th floor room was situated in the corner with a view of H Street and 11th street. Our corner room was spacious and clean. There was some noise from the buses and police sirens but we live in NYC so it wasn't an issue for us.
 Tons of restaurants nearby at all different price levels. We walked to most of the museums.
If you have mobility issues, ask for a room closer to the elevator since the walk from the elevator bank (6 sets) is quite long given that this is an atrium style hotel.
The "Metro Center" Metro stop has an underground passageway into the Grand Hyatt which was ultra convenient since it was very cold. The Hotel's indoor parking garage was full the day we arrived so we parked in the lot across the street from the Hotel entrance (enter on 9th Street between "H" and "I" streets) for $20 for each 24-hour period.

input_doc: My daughter and I had just completed an across the US road trip and arriving at the Marriott was like hitting an oasis in a desert! input_doc:
My Family of 4 stayed here in January it was our last stop after a four week stay in the cold climates of London Paris and New York, so not only were we a lot warmer but walking into our apartment was a joy, the kids who had their own apartment next to ours were ecstatic, these apartments our gorgeous and luxurious and soooo reasonably priced! I have recommended them to our friends already. The staff were nice and friendly and greeted us with a smile every day, the pool area is lovely and water is heated too, there is a small bar and restaurant but we 
The pool area is lovely and water is heated too, there is a small bar and restaurant that looks cosy, but we preferred the room service so we could enjoy the apartment, the menu is the same. There is also a day spa on the premises but it seemed quite expensive and a hairdresser. The hotel is on Wiltshire Boulevard which is very long, but away from the main centre near Rodeo Drive, we travelled by taxi, it was totally fine and convenient for us.
There is bus stop out the front of the hotel as well if you don't like to travel by taxi, if you like walking there is a great shopping centre called Century City which takes about about 15 mins
by foot. We dined at a fantastic restaurant called Rock Sugar at Century City, you will also find two department stores a grocery store and lots of designer and fashion stores.
We will definitely stay here again if ever we get back to L.A!
.

input_doc: Stayed here in May 2010 for one night. Arrival by car was wayyyy easier than at any other downtown hotel we have stayed in, no mazes to drive thru or around, just a simple right turn off curtis and we were in valet. A few steps inside and we were at checkin, and about two minutes later we were in our corner room on the 6th floor. The room was very big, very clean, and very quiet. The bed was really comfortable. Everyone was friendly and helpful. It was an entirely wonderful hotel. Our only complaint would be that in the morning Rialto's restaurant was a bit full of loud partyers taking advantage of the all you can drink bloody mary and mimosa bar. But that was minor and we will stay here again!

input_doc:
Quick shuttle service from airport. 
Room ready upon our arrival at 1:35pm. Bay view room received as requested on Priority Club Floor. Nice room lay-out and great Bay View. 
Walked to Seaport Village quite easily, lots of homeless around this area. 
Television noise from other rooms could be heard, but we were soooooo tired we fell asleep.
Beautiful view from balcony. Watched 3 cruise ships arrive early in the morning. 
Wheeled our large luggage easily to the Port Terminal early in morning and returned to hotel room to enjoy until we checked out and boarded vessel.
Hotel does offer luggage transfer to ship, we just did this ourselves.

input_doc: We had a great time in New York and the hotel was great too. I really can't say something negative with the exception of the pricing of everythink. Yeah, i know, it is a five star restaurant, but 38 USD per person for breakfast on top of the price for the room is not acceptable. So i had to go to Starbucks every morning to get our coffee and somethink else. 10 USD for both! I looked also at the room service, but i would never eat a sandwich for 30 USD. i can't taste sooooo good. Finally we only used the hotel for sleeping and to enjoy the view on the harbour and the statue of liberty.

input_doc: My husband and I stayed at the Boston Back Bay Copley Square Hotel over 10/31/11 during the Nor'easter. I have to say that I was extremely impressed with the honesty as I left my fur coat, sweater, and scarf in the closet upon checking out. It wasn't until we arrived home 7 hours later that I discovered this faux pas. The hotel retrieved the items and immediately mailed them to me overnight fed ex. They were a gift to me and I would have been devastated if they would have been stolen. I was so impressed with the honesty and integrity of this hotel, that I would most definitely stay there again!!! Lisa and Art, Cape May Court House, NJ.

input_doc: This hotel is beautiful, the staff is amazing! This is a well run hotel! The rooms are newly remodeled and beautifully decorated ( we didnt even notice how small it was), the linens were very nice - the bed was soooo comfortable. Our room was floor to ceiling windows with a view of three bridges and the new york skyline. The hotel provides an Ipad in each room with free internet, ( although the internet was not as high speed as I would have liked and they put their own interface to help guests, but it made using the internet a bit tedious ) a small desk, and mini bar. Concierge services were excellent. They held our bags before check in as well as after as we still had several hours to see more of the city before our flight out . They even offered 1:00 pm check out at no charge, which I have heard other hotels charge for. They also have a few decks off of the lobby ( 2nd floor) for outdoor seating, with umbrellas, chairs and coffee tables.

input_doc:
Stayed here this Memeorial day weekend. had a great time nice property great staff Erica who checked us in at the front desk fantastic job and just lovely. Nice patio to sit out and enjoy wine great bartenders who ebbed blended us a special birthday drink! Couple blocks from Beale street. our room overlooked Silky Ullivans bar. Beware bring earplugs because the music may keep you up. There is not a swimming pool here and the gym is nothing to write home about. Restaurant was fine for breakfast there is a Starbucks around the corner if you chose to go there instead of the hotel.stafff all very friendly.
 Would stay here agin.

input_doc: Everything about my stay at the Sheraton BWI was awesome from beginning until the end. Check in was a breeze. I knew we would be arriving at the hotel very late that evening and when we arrived it was as if they were waiting on me. The hotel lobby was very inviting and relaxed. The room was excellent!!! I truly wanted to buy one of the pillows in the room but didn't want to sound silly at checkout so I didn't. I will be staying at the Sheraton for years to come and look forward to staying very soon...Cynthia Bovain DeLardge

Its a small hotel with plenty of charizma. Each floor had cute and different themed lounges with a computer. The beds were small but oh sooo comfy. The hotel is centrally located near great shopping, Theaters and more. The staff was very helpful. This is my hotel of choice when attending a show at the theatre across the street.

I've stayed here before back when it was Portland Hotel. Terrible experience.This has changed dramatically. Even though this hotel is expensive it is totally worth it. Location in midtown is the best, you are a few steps from times square, rockefeller center, st. patricks cathedral, diamond district etc. The front desk staff is exceptional and surprisingly very nice. (not that way when it was portland hotel). Rooms are comfy, well decorated and we rested very well in those sheets and matress. Hope to be back soon!!!

input_doc: We booked this hotel thru Hotwire.com and I was initially concerned after reading some reviews on this venue. We were amazed and VERY happy with the Roosevelt Hotel. Great location, staff and superior value for the money. Am rather surprised with a few reviews on this venue complaining of small rooms, wifi charges and high parking rates. These are standard charges for ANY New York City hotel and size of room is commensurate to the market for this city. Superior value and love the staff!!!!

Yes location couldnt be better!!! Directly at pier 39! Rooms are ok compared to the price. The staff is friendly!
Good choice!! If i come back i will stay there again!

input_doc: I stayed for 5 days with a party of 3 others. On day 3 we received 2 towels but no other time during our stay did we get fresh linen. Stayed there because of the great location but on the second day upon returning to the hotel with my group, my pajama shirt was laid out on my bed with obvious semon on it!!!! upon returning home i noticed i only had 2 of the 6 pairs of underwear i had brought with me! As for the service we didn't have any. The beds were comfy but there is a bloody tampon under the bed on the east side of the room that remained there everyday we stayed. The elevators are TINY (3 normal sized people per elevator) and they are also used by cleaning staff so in the morning it's a wait game to get into one of the two elevators. Great place to stay if you like strangers bodily fluids in your room.

This was a wonderful hotel with really exceptional service. The rooms were lovely and rather quiet, especially considering that they were sold out all 3 evenings that we were there. The bathrooms here are amazing and very large with a seperate shower and tub. Elways restaurant was great for brunch as well as cocktail hour. We had room service one evening and our food was brought promptly and still was piping hot. The stafff was friendly, attentive and very informed. The only negitive thing about this hotel would be it's location. While it is walking distance to 16th street, it is still rather out of the way. However, it would not stop me from staying here in the future.

input_doc:
We went to celebrate my 40th birthday and it was awseome, from the lobby to the check-in. Daniel and Michael were just great, they answered questions we had and the cookies they give at check-in were warm and yummy. they get to know us by room so when we walked in they acknowledged us by room, they are the reason NY was great...
The rooms were clean and even smelled clean. The coffee was great with everything in the room, the Bell Hops were all great... we will be back for sure, thanks again Michael and Daniel for making our first trip NY the best ever!!!!!!!!

We had a great time staying at the Westin for our first time in New York. The staff was pleasant and the room with the view was great! It was exactly what we booked! I LOVE the fact that they will let you check your bags before your room is ready if you arrive in New York early and on our last day they let us check them again after we checked out of our room because we did not leave the city till 8pm. This allowed us to see more of the city without lugging our luggage around. We also ordered room service and although it was a bit pricey(but most room service is) the food was GREAT!!!! Everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and delicious! The bed was also one of the best nights sleep ever! If you want a great priced hotel in Times Square I would choose the Westin again anyday!

input_doc: I stayed at this hotel for a conference the first week of October. Upon checkin they had overbooked their studios so I was upgraded to a suite. The room was amazing!!! The staff that assisted were all very nice and talkative. I ate at Maryjane's for breakfast almost every day and the eggs benedict, traditional style, were to die for! If you don't get the eggs benedict you must try the hash browns though! I would definitely go back, but next time take my wife!!!

input_doc:
Overall, the hotel is very clean and comfy. When you drive to the hotel, it is not the most pleasant drive along the freeway and feeder road, need about 20 to 30 mins to get to downtown during rush hours. Area is not the nicest, but it is safe enough for a female single business traveler like me. 
If you get an upgrade room to a suite, it is big!!! It is comfy. The regular room is okay, but the room felt a little bit dark and tight. The room is clean. 
Comfy stay for a few nights, not bad for the money.. It is relatively good value!

input_doc: Because of availability, I had to book another hotel for my first night in town. After that, I checked into the Hilton. As soon as I stepped into the lobby, I was impressed - this was in a different class than the hotel I had just left. The lobby has a pleasant scent and it is elegantly decorated. There are many places to sit along with a coffee/bakery kiosk, a restaurant, and some gift shops. The staff in the lobby area was very friendly and accomodating. My room was nice - it was in a corner area so I think it was larger than other standard rooms. It did cost $15/day for wifi, so that was a little disappointing but I guess that's what you get at higher end hotels. It was soooo easy to walk to the GBR conference center from here - there is an indoor skywalk bridge on both the 2nd and 3rd floors. I'd recommend this to others who are in Houston for conferences.

input_doc: We stayed at the Milford plaza this past week! It is a great location no doubt but that concludes the great things about this hotel. The lobby/ check in desk are all under construction and was so unorganized. This hotel claims to be modern/ contemporary but there is nothing modern about the elevators and it was pure ciaos! The only lobby bathroom was dirty and the door was broken, my friend had to hold the door for me. There wasn't even a sign stating that it was a bathroom we had to ask. I had a package delivered to the hotel that they lost since they had no organization, even the security guard said there was no organization. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!! Nor could you pay me to stay here, but if you don't care about any of those things the location was great and the broom closets they call rooms were actually clean.

input_doc: I booked 2 suites w/queen beds thru Hotels.com. They gave us rooms that were next to each other without having to ask. We usually stay in hotels like La Quinta or Quality Inn but for less $$ Cambria was so much better. It had a real lobby with sofas and a big screen tv, and 2 desktop computers for guest use. It had a snack bar, free (good) coffee, and a place to buy snacks, OTC medicines, toothpaste, etc...The front desk staff were always nice. The rooms were clean, the bedding was so nice, everything in a modern but comfortable decor. The bathroom was big, clean, Bath & Body Works toiletries. Since nobody's perfect I'll say there isn't a nice view - the property is sorrounded by vacant lots - maybe that's why the rates were so affordable. I will definately come back to this place!!!

input_doc:
I mentioned to our reservation representative that my husband was being deployed to Afghanistan for a year and that we were coming from Virginia to San Diego to visit our son at SDSU before my husband left. When we arrived to our room there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us and a note from Marquette saying that she hopes that we enjoy our visit with our son. WOW!!! What a personal touch. I have stayed at a Kimpton in San Francisco and D.C but this was just over the top. We will never stay at another Hotel in San Diego again.

input_doc: My daughter, her friend and myself stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 5 days last week. This was one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Our room was on the 31st floor and we had a corner room. The views were spectacular. Everyone was completely helpful. We were complete novices in the big city and the staff was always helpful and friendly. After seeing some of the other hotels that I was considering choosing, I am sooooo glad that we chose this one. We chose the Dumont because of the reviews on this website and they were completely on target. Thanks for making my daughter's graduation trip so wonderful.

input_doc:
We were actually meant to be staying in another hotel, however due to the snow blizzard we had to change properties (flight cancellations) and ended up staying for New Year (which was amazing!)
Service: The staff were really friendly and advised on local area and transport
Room: Brilliant, it was HUGE! with a walk in wardrobe, we loved it. Yes the kitchen is from 1970 but that didn't matter as who eats in when you're staying in NY!!! (p.s. i'm not rich, its just there's soooo many places to eat!)
It would have been nice to get a room with a view of the roads instead of the air con system between the surrounding buildings. Also a general pointer about NY, I think I know why they call it the city that never sleeps; its because of the police and fire sirens that echos around NY 24/7. That's not saying its a rough place, we saw absolutely no sign of crime and every street has at least 1 police car!
I want to live in NY and would feel happy living out of the Buckingham Hotel as its so homely.

input_doc:
If you need to be in (or near) downtown Houston for a couple of days, don't look any further. The hotel is clean, the rooms are huge with huge TV's, every room has a fridge and a microwave, there's a complimentary breakfast and a "happy hour" during which you get free drinks and snacks.
That is all very well, but what really makes your stay at this hotel worth your money is the very personal approach of the staff. Of course you can go to hospitality monsters like the Double Tree which is actually IN downtown Houston and not NEAR it, but you'll feel like a number, like a soulless statistic out there. 
So I'd say don't go to those horrible, huuuge hotels IN downtown Houston, just take this one. You'll love it.

input_doc: Our company had two seminars at this location in March 2011. From the very first contact until the last guest left all Sheraton employees were at their very best-and that's putting it mildly... The catering manager Eden is a blessing - our events were perfect till the last minute. She would anticipate our needs and proactively suggest various options until we found the perfect fit. We were treated with so much care, so much attention and everywhere we turned found only perfection. At the end of the day- when it was all over and we wanted to go sightseeing, they went out of their way to find us a rent-a-car after we were turned down by all airport rental places. This place works like a well organized bee hive - smooth, on time, as promised-just perfect. I would HIGHLY recommend it for any events and would definitely by all means return!!! input_doc: Absolutely loved the Four Seasons. Went to San Francisco just for the day, but ended up staying the night and wanted to stay at a popular hotel, since there are so many hotels we'd never heard of, we didn't want to take a chance. We expected excellent service, a great comfortable and CLEAN room from a 5 star hotel, and we got it all, the beds were very comfortable we didn't want to get up in the morning, so if you need to be somewhere early just be prepared to cancel your plans or just put them off for a while. The staff was sooo friendly, always opening the doors and greeting you, even at 2 in the morning! And even though we didn't drive a BMW or Mercedes like everyone else there they still treated us as if we did. Unfortunately the only bad part was that there were protestors outside, but it didn't stop us from getting the room, they were outstide of almost every hotel. We didn't get to check out the whole hotel since we stayed there on such short notice and for only a day but I imagine it was just as nice as the pictures show. Also, we stayed in a Deluxe room for $329 and got a corner room, it was great because we got 2 huge windows on the 14th floor, we couldn't see the whole city or anything, but we're not picky like all these other psychos that complain about every little thing, so we appreciated what we got and thought it was a nice view. Hope you choose to stay at the Four Seasons and get the same great service as we did!

input_doc: There is something wrong with this hotel. There is a scary, unsafe, dark vibe that comes from within the rooms and hallways. input_doc: We had the most pleasant stay at the Residence Inn this past week. The staff was super friendly and attentive. We couldn't have asked for cleaner rooms. The breakfast was out of this world with great attention details while keeping a crowded dining room completely happy....they even had waffle machines in the shape of Texas! The only drawback I can think of is the $20 plus you'll spend on parking every night, but it's worth it for the valet parking during the San Antonio heat.....self park or valet is the same price. I noticed that other hotels w/o their own parking garage also charge the same fee. All in all, I would truly give this hotel and its staff 10 stars if I could!

input_doc: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway twice in December 2009, self, wife, daughter and her boyfriend. We liked the bigger than usual rooms, comfortable beds (best anywhere!), convenience to and shuttle connection to LAX and the free broadband (in the lobby), Having a Starbucks on the premises was a bonus. Also, the valet parking was quick and reliable, if a bit expensive..... We couldn't get the in room broadband to work and the IT Help Desk (external to hotel) was on message, so no help!! So I asked the Desk to refund the four day broadband charge I had committed to and they said they did, after I returned home it appeared on my credit card!! Now they're not answering email!! input_doc: We just returned from a four night stay at the Westin Time Square Feb.17th 2005. First, four days before we were set to arrive we were e-mailed about a room upgrade for another $35.00 a night we gladly accepted, we were already paying $269.00 a night. Upon arrival at 10:30 a.m. Thursday morning we asked about the upgraded room and we were told they had none available!!!!! When we got to our room is was soooo tiny I couldn't believe it. Unpacking was impossible since they only give you three drawers for your clothes. The bathroom was okay but the robe that they hung in the bathroom had a huge hole in it, so I placed the robe with the used towels the next morning only to find the same robe hanging up again that afternoon (YUK!) The final straw was a blood stain on the white duvet cover and it was put back on the bed instead of a clean one!!!!!! overall our vacation was great but I would certainly find a different hotel next time.

input_doc: Stayed at the Millennium Bostonian for 3 nights in early October. Got a great rate ($116) a night on Hotwire. Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel......from it's close proximity to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, the subway system, the cozy Atrium Lounge and it's warmth. Their bed was comfortable (as were the pillows). The bathroom was well lit with an oval bathtub (very nice). The only thing that could have been different was that I wish they would install a new carpet in the room.....yes, there were stains. input_doc: 70 Park Avenue is a lovely hotel in a great area of Manhattan. We were able to walk everywhere and we did just that. Grand Central is only mins away as are various bars restaurants etc... Thoroughly recommend Moonstruck 244 Madison avenue for good value burgers and the like.... The room size is good the bed is absolutely fabulously comfy and it was a lovely surprise for my husband to receive a bottle of bubbly and a small birthday cake shortly after checking in. Thank you very much !! The rooms were kept lovely and clean and we had a glass of wine each evening "on the house" between 5 and 6 another lovely touch. My colleague and I had meetings all over Manhattan, knowing every clients' 1st question is..."Where did you stay?" we wanted to have a good answer. So we stayed one week at the Hudson hotel in a Double Deluxe room. The beds were soooo comfortable, everything was always clean when we came back from a long day of meetings. Shacazia at the concierge desk also was so helpful, by the end of the week I was hugging her goodbye, incredible service, she would do just about anything for us to make sure we were situated well. 
Then the night club had a really nice scene, I worked it out in advance with the concierge to be able to bring my clients into the night club for a few drinks thursday night, the place was hopping, not too jammed packed but filled with fun people having a good time.

input_doc: Hmmm where shall i start? The first thing that really disappointed me was when we (my family) first arrived at the Bahia Hotel. We went to check in and our reservations were changed without us knowing about it. So we ended staying in a room that was very run down, the beds were very uncomfortable, the sofa was very old and the plumbing was very bad in the kitchen and bathroom. Second thing that disappointed me was the maid service. It took 2 or 3 pnone calls for them to bring towels to our room and when the maids came to "clean" our rooms (if thats what you call it) it never looked liked they cleaned the room at all, the bathroom was still dirty, carpet still had sand on it. It seemed the only thing they did was change the towels and make the beds.The third thing that I couldn't believe happened was when all my beach towels got stolen from my patio. I think with all the homeless people and party animals around the Bahia they should have some kind of security patrolling the area around the Bahia more often especially at night! I will definitely be staying somewhere else the next time I visit San Diego!!!!!!!

input_doc: Ooohhh my goodness.. I just loved my stay. The inside of this place is awsome to see.. if you enjoy crown molding, grand pianos, marble floors, mirrors, and lots and lots of windows, this is the place for you. the night before my wedding, the bridal party stayed here, check in was a hassle, we reserved our rooms on the internet 1 day inadvance, (we could have gone anywhere, but since the theme of my wedding was the royal princess, I wanted to start early, it just set the right theme) they did not have the reservations, it took 2 managers and a desk clerk to finally find our rooms, but once that was done, I cannot tell you enough, the room service was fast, the servers were nice. The room was very clean, everything was perfect. This is the place to go, if you want to go all out for yourself, or any special night event. Parking was either vallet or park at the mall lot across the street.. we chose vallet (of course). All in all, I will stay there again, we have since moved from Indianapolis, but I will always make my stay there at the Caterbuy.

input_doc:
while the exchange rate offers $2 to the pound this is luxury thats merely very very pricey rather than unaffordable so we splashed out and it was great.
We had the most basic room package with no food so can't comment on the food. The room was large spacious, bright, with a large flat TV and a good big bathroom with 2 basins.
Excellent tea and coffeee maker in a big wooden case by the door is very welcome after a hard day shopping and sightseing.
A tray of chocolates with a farewell message on the last night was a nice personal touch.
Great location near to Union Square shops, with cable car stop right outside and Chinatown round the corner.
Swimming pool and whirlpool spa were enjoyed by us daily and were never busy.
A later checkout at 1400 was readily agreed to without any hassle, unlike many hotels which strongly resist a request to stay beyond 12 and make you feel unwelcome.
Concierge was very helpful, as we asked him to find out if Armistead Maupin was doing a signing of his new book while we were there - he found out within minutes and sent up a map of the location and a newspaper article on him from the previous day. Top marks for speed and helpfulness

Not only did this hotel provide EXCELLENT sleep quality, but it was ultra modern, in a great location, and it was downright awesome. input_doc:
We got a great price on this room & for the amount we paid - it was the best value!
The room was a good size with a funky sofa on one side.
Best part was the bed. HEAVENLY & sooo comfortable... and huge!
The shower head was also amazing!
Nice & quiet, good location. 
The hotel had a really cool "zen" theme which I really like & gave the place a serene feeling.
The doorstaff/porters were really nice & helpful.
I would recommend this hotel to either business travellers, or tourists that want a nice comfortable bed to flop into after a busy day sightseeing.

input_doc: Such a perfect stay! The rooms are of a brilliant quality, really comfortable beds and lovely city views, with a nice bathroom too. input_doc:
Having just returned from our first trip to New York, we felt we had to praise the Affinia 50 hotel. 
The hotel's location was first-class, with a good selection of restaurants close-by (try the Mexican on 2nd Ave - Zarella'a; and the diner a few doors up for a great breakfast). 
The room we were given was spacious, clean and well-appointed. The bed was sooooo comfortable! The staff in the hotel couldn't do enough for you - but weren't 'over the top', just friendly and helpful.
The subway was only a block away, and is an efficient system that gets you all around New York. 
For a great place for drinks, try the quirky Monkey bar at the Hotel Elysee (about 10 mins from the Affinia 50) or for a treat, the bar on the 23rd floor of The Peninsula Hotel - great views of the city! 
Thanks to the Affinia 50 for making our first trip to New York so enjoyable!!

We stayed in The Lenox at end of September 2011. It was my birthday and they arranged a bottle of wine and balloons to be waiting for us. A lovely welcome.
The position is excellent and we walked everywhere or used the T. We had breakfast there which was good and the recommendations for meals etc were excellent. We had a lovely room on the Pure Floor which was a treat we didn't expect. The bed was sooo comfy!

input_doc: I always have a good experience here...great location....service was impressive and good quality rooms..the hotel staff was great!! Will be staying her again and I recommend this hotel especially if you are having fun in the city and arent't spending much time in the room anyway..

VERY nice remodeled rooms. We just stayed one night but will stay again. Staff was soooo friendly and let us check in early. Breakfast is typical pastry, bagel, waffles but had an attentive server to keep things stocked and clean. Can't beat the price for this value and location.

We rocked up for from our travelling around the stunning coastline of New England, greeted with fabulous staff who were kind enough to get us a room with the corner view. The staff honestly couldn't do enough, were charming, the room was ridiculously luxurious & delivered the glamour that one expects from the W, and I honestly don't even know where to begin with the quality of the bedding! My husband & I have officially fallen in love with the pillows...we need some at home now!! Breakfast was perfect & we had found an amazing restaurant that was incredible in the hotel mag! Who could ask for more??? Thank you all at the W of Boston! It was great that we were so central & you made our lovely trip to the region even more memorable than it was before! Namaste.

input_doc:
We stayed here for 3 nights this week having chosen carefully from the reviews on this site, and it was perfect. I was dreading arriving and being disappointed with the room or noise etc, but it was absolutely ideal. It is justifiably in the top 10(ish) of most popular hotels.
The hotel could not be in a better location being minutes from Times Square, Bryant Park, Penn Station, Macy's, Grand Central and the Empire States Building.
The hotel is shoe-horned into a slim space betweeen two office blocks, but is incredibly well-kept and quiet. The staff were extremely polite and welcoming, the concierge was excellent, and the room was lovely. It is true that the bed was the comfiest I have ever known!
I can be quite critical, but cannot find a single fault with this hotel. If you are able to afford to pay about $300 per night, definitely stay here.
I am hoping to return to NY and will certainly be back at this hotel.

input_doc: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! My friend and I found bed bugs in our beds!! We left immediately and asked for a refund. The guy at the front desk said he could not do anything without the manager, who would be in the following day. My friend then attempted to call the manager, leaving multiple messages on two subsequent days after leaving, but to no avail. She plans on calling the corporate office to request her refund. input_doc: I had been to NY many times on business, but wanted a family friendly hotel in a central location to bring my family (mum and two 7 year olds) for their first trip to NY from the UK. The Hilton Garden Inn seemed ideal and even exceeded our expectations. It was really close to Time Square, but probably the quietest hotel I have stayed in, we all had a great nights' sleep and the two queen beds were soooo comfy! Rather than earn more Hilton points we opted for the buffet breakfast in the cafe adjoining the hotel, which was really good also. input_doc: Stayed at the Hotel from the 21st to the 26th November as part of our Honeymoon, Excellent location we arrived via Newark Airport, travelled in via Airtrain and walked from the Penn Station to the hotel. Centrally located to the 5th avenue shops, Macys 5 minutes away and Times Square only 10 minutes away. The room was on the 7th floor and we got a good view of the Empire State Building especially lit at night. We would also say the king size bed and the pillows were grrrrrreat and because the hotel is on the street and not avenue it was fairly quite at night so we got some good sleep. We had planned to go out for breakfast but were that impressed with the continental breakfast we ended up there every morning. Great staff and excellent service, On the last day we had a late flight so the hotel stored our luggage and on return they allowed us to use the showers and changing room in the fitness centre before setting off.

input_doc: We had heard this hotel this was THE place to stay...so we gave it a try. What a big disappointment to say the very least. input_doc:
I booked this because of it's proximity to the airport for our departure. The staff was friendly and helpful, they upgraded our room to queen beds without us asking. The rooms are lovely, and the hotel is quiet even though it is so close to the airport.
The 24 hour shuttle to the airport is very, very convenient and gets you there in about 4 minutes. We ate at the restaurant and the food was good hearty and the best avocado I've ever had.....so all in all you can't beat the deal, the location, the clean rooms, and the service.....

input_doc: Thinking of visiting Chicago? Don't hesitate to stay at the Hampton Inn in Downtown! It's clean, comfortable, practical, modern, well-located and affordable. The service couldn't be better!!! The people in the front desk are really helpful and nice (Yaneli, Tracee, Janet...). This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at, in terms of quality and price. input_doc: Great place!!!!! We had an excellent stay at Farmers Daughter Hotel. The staff is wonderful and the service is unbeatable. You've got to try their quaint little restaurant called Tart, not only were there local people eating there but we were able to do some star gazing at the same time, it was great!! The rooms are like none other we've experienced in our travels. They have that awesome country theme that made us feel at home, from the comfortable beds to the flat screen tv's to the down home hospitality you definately get your money's worth. input_doc: We booked a double room at this hotel and we stayed for 4 nights. The check in was really quick and easy; they even let us check in a few hours earlier and the hotel staff were really helpful welcoming. In the lobby, the concierge desk was great as they helped us find attractions in New York and recommended places for us to visit. There were even some ipads for visitor use if we needed to search for some information on the internet. Our room was clean and was a perfect size. The location of the hotel was fantastic, it was just a minutes walk down to Times Square which was excellent. This meant the hotel was near to restaurants and shops, so it was very convenient for us. The prices for food in the hotel were quite expensive, but due to the location there were plenty of places to eat for breakfast and dinner nearby. If travelling to New York, I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

input_doc:
I got to this hotel early April and i must say it was fantastic. Smallish room but no way as small as people had warned me about, so maybe it was generally big for Manhattan. Generally the hotel was super clean and well presented, all in all i can't really complain. The FREE bottled water, WIFI access and PC's with free printing was also fabulous to get all your documents like tickets etc printed. 
Finally i'd like to the add the staff was really good especially Christina (i think that was her name, usually on evening shifts) she was great help, always welcomed us with a Heyyy and a fab smile.
Overall i suggest you go here if you can as its great in all aspects and SOOOOO central we managed to go everywhere walking from our hotel!

input_doc:
This is the third time I stayed at the Mark Hopkins - and while I was initially concerned about the 2nd floor room they assigned me, the view was actually pretty cool off of Nob Hill towards Market Street/the South. Room was large and super clean.
The only thing that irked me was the painfully slow wireless internet connection. It was inconsistent, and slow - especially for watching streaming video/music. This is San Fran - center of the tech world - there is no reason why the internet connection should be soooooo slooooow.
Service was fine and location is great - will stay again, but hopefully they will up the connection speed on their wireless routers...

input_doc: This is a big, busy place but with lots of amenities and a location that cant be beat: a very easy walk to the Lakefront, Watertower Place, Apple Store, restaurants, etc. I snagged a Fri. & Sat. night stay on Priceline for just $130 a nighta bargain for downtown Chicago and for a hotel of this quality. Nothing too special about my room, but it was clean and had everything I needed. One complaint: I HATE places that charge you fifteen bucks a day for Internet service in your room! This hotel bills itself as a luxury hotelin my view, if its that great a place they ought to provide you with free Internet! I guess instead that means they will nickel and dime you on everything. The vast majority of hotels I stay at these days, even upscale ones, include Internet at no charge, so boooo on Marriott for that. Still, if you want a nice room at a terrific location, this is it.

input_doc: The Cassa Hotel in NYC is awesome! The staff are so friendly and accomodating. They helped with dinner selections, theatre and directions. The hotel is very clean ~ and very centrally located to Rockafella Center and Times Square. The Manhattan Cafe just a few doors down offer a wide selection of food and beverages. input_doc: I made the mistake of booking the hotel through kayak.com, which did not send the confirmation to the hotel. Once I tried to check in the employees were all very polite while assisting me with trying to find my reservation, long story short they allowed me to check in without having to wait for kayak to fax over the confirmation. Their service is second to none, they were all super polite and extremely helpful. I dealt with 2 different concierges, who both provided beyond what I was looking for. My room as a superior king that was very nice with everything you can expect from a top hotel. This is definitely my go to hotel for Philadelphia, I can't wait to go back!!!

input_doc: Needed a 1 night stay in Chicago for business. Being a true believer, I chose the Palomar based on Trip Advisor ratings and was very pleased. This hotel has an excelllent location for access to the highlights of downtown Chicago, walking distance to almost everything. It is spotlessly clean, super friendly staff, a delightful happy hour with really nice wine and a great night sleep. Couldn't ask for more. I'll go back on my annual trip to Chicago.

i rencently satyed at this hotel with my father and brother and my mother, and this was my first time i was in hotel in manhattan because we usually seelp at my uncle's house.
the hotel is half a block wide and has 44 floors on 6 ave @ 53d street. 
the lobby is very big and the hotel has direct elevators to te floors and the wait isn't long, the cheak is very fast and efficiant and even there is a confrence there.
the rooms aren't big but much bigger then other hotel rooms in the city, from the windows you see the urban jungle of manhattan. i had a room in the 42nd floor and the view was amazing. 
the bathrooms are modern and have sunken sinks in marble tables, the batherooms are quite small.
we recived an upgrade to use the lounge which is on the 44th floor which had amazing views of central park and the empire state building.
with good breakfast and all day long hor'devoures
the hotel has a big fitness center and an indoor pool but i didn't have time ot use them.
the hotel isn't cheep but with good service and the fact that central park, times sq, the moma, radio city muisc hall, are 5 min from the hotel , it's worthwhile
Thank you hilton for an amazing stay!!!!

input_doc:
Great Hotel, What a super experience!!! Right from the second we walked through the front door we were met with the friendliest staff we have encountered. Everyone, from the maids restaurant, front desk, bellman to the Manager were really friendly and happy to talk to us.
The room was nice the bed was comfortable and clean. 
The food was pretty good with a great choice of Asian. Plenty of variety for breakfast. Many restaurants in the area
The bar staff were very efficient and friendly especially Grace. 
It is just a quick walk to Times Square. Enjoyed the staff and the stay. Would recommend and will be returning next year.

input_doc: I booked the eldon suites for my birthday and paid for my hotel. UPON ARRIVAL I was informed that I would not be able to stay at the hotel that I had already paid for due to the fact that I did not have a major credit card for incidentals even though I was never informed that I would need one. The front desk attendant was very rude and sarcastic and told me I could have someone come and bring me a credit card at 10pm at night. There was also bo manager available that I could speak to and no hotel policy i could receive a copy off. I ended up having to book another hotel, and was two hours late for my own birthday dinner. I still have not received my refund from the Eldon (it's been over a week). I have stayed at many 5 star hotels in DC (monaco,mayflower,quincy) and never had this issue. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

input_doc: My 13 year old son and I stayed here for one week in july this year. Very happy with the whole trip, including the hotel stay. The only backside was the pricey breakfast and the ignorant waiters working there. Sorry guys....it`s just not good enough in a classy hotel like this. The food itself was good though.

input_doc:
Buyer beware!!! There are plenty of other hotels in the area. My advice is to not stay here!
The entire place needs serious updating.
Our room was adjacent to the pool and elevator therefore we had everyone go by our room at all hours of the night. 
The room had a musty/mildew odor that was covered up by some sort of nauseating airfreshner. We felt like we were in a dingy basement room . Horrible.

input_doc: This is my first time staying at any Hard Rock Hotel. To begin, before we got there we had to juggle our reservation a little, because I was getting there early and made a separate reservation from my boyfriend. Aaron (the concierge in charge of bands - we were there for my boyfriends' band) was amazing. He took care of everything with no problems and even gave me his cell phone number just in case there was a problem There were no problems. Everyone at the front desk, bell hops, people working in the bar were soooo nice. Very helpful. The room was great, we had an amazing view from the 23rd floor of the river and Michigan Ave. Can't beat the location, it's central to Millenium park and the museums and Magnificent Mile. I would definitely stay again.
