input_doc: I have stayed in NYC now 4 times, each time we do better, this is my favorite hotel, clean, great service an right, yes right in times square! Great flatscreen tv, big size bathroom an nice beds! Star bucks in the lobby! Big drawback - the view restaurant soooooo overpriced! Dinner was just fair, buffet was 35 dollars a person, does not include even water, 12 dollars for 2 sodas no refills! 2 coffees 11.00 no refills! Try hard rock or bubba humps always great meal an we paid half the price! I was soooo disappointed in dinner 200 dollars an than waiter added 30 for his tip - for what not filling my sodas!

input_doc: A friend and I stayed here for 2 days. The rooms were clean. The beds were sooo comfortable. The continental breakfast was delish! Love love love the waffle maker! The front desk staff was very polite. They offer free coffee and tea daily and cookies in the afternoon. I will definitely stay here again! Great location and within walking distance from broadway!

We recently stayed at this hotel for a swim meet. The location was perfect. Within walking distance to IU and other downtown destinations. The room was very spacious and well appointed. The beds were great and it was awesome to have a kitchen. The pool/spa area was very well maintained and provided some much needed relaxation. The morning breakfast was hot and fresh and very convenient. Lastly, the staff could not have been friendlier. Every time we entered or left the hotel, we were greated. Thanks to Vicky, the hotel manager for EVERYTHING!!!

input_doc: My husband and I went to Hotel Drisco (which we had never heard of before) as a gift. What a wonderful gift it was for us! We've never gone to a hotel where there was someone to open the front door for us or where the front desk hands you a plate with warm wet wash cloths to wipe your face and hands after your long trip to get there. Nice touch! The room was lovely (A King Suite-Wong Room). It had fresh whole fruit in a basket ready to eat, robes and slippers for each person and some special treats for use in the bathroom. The bed was soooo comfortable and we are a bit picky when it comes to hotel beds. The continental breakfast was just delicious and there was a great variety of foods and beverages to choose from that morning. I'm so glad we were able to go, and we are looking forward to coming back when our anniversary rolls around.

input_doc:
The Hilton Inn at Penn is one of those hotels that think that $230 per night is not enough income, and charges extra for anything imaginable. Exhorbant telephone prices are a norm in hotels, and the Inn at Penn is no different. However, charging $10/day for internet access and charging by-the-minute and by the page for printing and faxing is waaay too much. Even parking was not included in room price, and I had to choose between $25/day valet parking or a $22/day parking garage several blocks away. The mini-bar automatically charges your account if anything moves inside, even if it's not used.
Combine these together and I could have stayed at a $40/night motel for rooms the same size (incl breakfast and wireless internet) and without dreading my every step.
My hotel stay was paid for by a third party, but next time I will specifically ask anyone inviting me not to book a Hilton.

4. **Elevator Analysis:** All agents agreed on a negative sentiment regarding the elevator issue, with phrases like "took forever" and "only problem!!" emphasizing the frustration. The intensity of -4 matches the negative sentiment strength observed in the agents' outputs.

input_doc: We stayed at this hotel with our team for a softball tournament. Check in was quick and easy with a very helpfull staff. The 1st night our A/C did not cool properly but I called the front desk the next morning and it was fixed by the time we returned to our room that afternoon. There is a Denny's restaurant right next door so we walked there for breakfast in the mornings. There was security present in the parking lots at all times. Coming in from the ball park late Saturday night we needed to wash uniforms along with all the other teams staying there so there was a line waiting for the washers & dryers. I asked the front desk clerk if there were any options and she was sooo nice. She called the hotel next door and made arrangements for us to do our laundry there. input_doc: This place is soooo overpriced. We stayed at another hotel that was closer to Times Square, bigger, with far more amenities and cheaper. However, on the last night of our trip that hotel was booked and the Americana was the only inn with a room. Yes, it was reasonably clean. But it was also incredibly small and noisy. I could hear people all night--until 3 and 4 a.m. --as the doors to nearby rooms slammed shut. True, our room had a flat screen tv. But the floors were linoleum, the towels were worn, and there wasn't even a mirror or piece of artwork in the room. The Americana takes spartan to a whole new level.

input_doc: I am a business traveler and found the Hilton Garden Inn very business traveler friendly. They have a business center where you can print, copy, surf, use office supplies, i.e. stapler, scotch tape, envelopes, FedEx and Ups shipping supplies, as well as different size paper for printing different size documents as well as a system that allows you to print from your own laptop, FOR FREE!!!! Most business centers charge internet charges plus printing charges just to print a single boarding pass. It is a relief to stay somewhere where they understand the needs of the business traveler. The hotel is clean, friendly, food is good, and the staff is friendly and efficient. They even have beach equipment to rent for the weekend... I love staying here.

input_doc: by the time we stayed at this Ramada we had traveled almost 2 mths and stayed at many hotels-99% of them part of the Wyndham Rewards. This was the NICEST of all the places we stayed!! We had stayed at several Ramada's on our travels and was pleased with every one of them but this one exceeded our expectations. The room was clean, spacious, quiet, the towels were luxerious, shower water pressure very good, and once I figured out how to use the coffee maker the coffee was great! Stayed from the 24th November for 5 nights booked a suite for 2 adults and 2 children very comfortable our bedroom had 2 double beds sooo comfortable.The staff were extremely helpful and the cleaning lady would never take the tip I left her, without me leaving a note.Each day when we came back to our room my daughters toy monkey used to be propped up in different poses on her pillow I thought what a lovely touch.Rooms spotless my only problem was the draughty windows if only they would double glaze the windows it would more than half the traffic noise and keep away the draughts from under the curtains.We loved New York and will return, maybe to a different hotel.I thought it was a bit too expensive 3,400 dollars with no breakfast!

The manager has gone to great detail and effort to make this much more of 4-5 star hotel than the rates would seem to imply. The location makes it easy to get anywhere by walking or a short tax ride. input_doc: We thoroughly enjoyed our anniversary vacation at the Old Town Inn. It was perfect as only one half hour from home and yet we felt a million miles away. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We loved our luxurious room with private spa and fireplace. Yet a block away we had numerous restaurants, fun shops and plenty of tourist attractions to keep us busy. Especially enjoyable was the delicious breakfast of fresh cooked waffles with fruit and syrup as well as assorted breakfast items to start the day. We can't wait until our next anniversary so we can go back to peace and relaxation, enjoying a break from the hectic routine to celebrate our married life together. We highly recommend this hotel!!!

input_doc:
Stayed for 2 nites March 1-3 04. Really enjoyed it. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the location is great. The room was nice with a great view of the Golden Gate which I awoke to in the morning. 
Great Sony TV and radio. Highly recommend!!!!

I would normally consider a Hampton Inn a 2 star type of hotel, but this hotel was far better then I expected.
The rooms were all recently redone, and the beds were very comfortable. The huge flat screen tv and granite bathroom counters were a nice touch. The room also came with a refridgerator (it took me a bit to find it as it was in the closet). The morning breakast was hearty and the gym equipment was all brand new.
The only con was that the walls were pretty thin and the maids were a little pushy. 
Great for business!!!! If your looking to just visit San Diego, Id reccomend staying a bit closer in. Its not far, but its at least a 10-15 min ride on the highway from downtown SD and at least the same to the closest beach.

input_doc: Arriving at 7.15pm room still not ready - had to wait an hour! No apology from management. Next day room not cleaned - had to complain and finally at 6 pm it was done - and the housekeeping manager blamed us for leaving a Do Not Disturb sign out.... if so how had someone gained access to repair the drapes? I was basically called a liar. Duty manager offered complimentary bottle of wine as apology - we're still waiting ..... Doormen and concierges very good, hotel management waste of time. On checking out they asked if we'd enjoyed our stay, and I replied "mixed" - they didn't ask why and could not care less. Lots of other hotels far superior - steer clear of this one.

input_doc:
Firstly, New York is a special place for me. I love the atmosphere, I love the commotion, I love the way of life - In short, I love New York!
I have stayed at the New Yorker Hotel twice before - the first back in November 2008 and the second September 2010. (I am only writing this review as I never reviewed on Trip Advisor then)
The first time we was in a small box room, the decor was quite old.... The second time I upgraded us to a suite with a balcony. What a treat! We had two huge TVs, a balcony looking over the city and breakfast vouchers for the Tick Tock diner! 
It is right by Madison Square Garden and has great links to the subway (right next to it), you are only a couple of blocks from Macy's and only a 10 minute walk to Times Sq.
I will be going back to New York soon, and I will go back to The New Yorker Hotel!

Well, AA managed to mess up a return flight from Maui (not flying with them again....) so we decided to follow some donut who said she had found a cheap hotel nearby. Cheap it was...but I had a good time with the wife and kids at the general horror stories that lurked around every corner. From the chef picking his nose in the fly ridden restaurant (give room service a miss!), the constant hum from the tv that required you bang the top or the Navy boy karaoke evening....

input_doc: After MANY trips to NYC, we found, quite by accident, the Aloft Harlem. What a find!!! This hotel was easily accessible, in close proximity to subway, clean, staff was EXTREMELY polite, kind & helpful and it was a fantastic bargain. Although we accidently checked-in one day prior to our booked reservation, the staff was very accommodating and able to find a room for us. The room was clean and stocked with everything you would need for a comfortable stay. I can not say enough positive comments about the staff - they were amazing! What a great stay and we will definitely return!!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our 3 night - NY city trip. The hotel's location is simply amazing. All the hotel employees we encountered were very prompt, very polite and willing to help out at all times. The room was very clean, cozy, tastefully decorated and large enough for both of us. We are definitely planning on staying at the hotel again when we go back to NY city.
Simply Excellent!!!!

input_doc: We were here for 1 night only but this place is amazing!!! The building is beautiful & the staff are warm & inviting after a long day of traveling! If you are looking to stay somewhere cool don't look any further. the shopping on Broadway is awesome but somtimes intense with all the people. input_doc: wonderful place....plan to come again in the near future...Ideal location of r new yourk

Thank you, Magnolia Hotel staff for a very nice stay. LOOOOOVE the complimentary foods and drinks, it was difficult to stop to eat on a busy business trip. Best feature by far to be able to grab breakfast, a drink AND cookies at bedtime.
Didn't use fitness amenities, can't comment on that.
Elevators are not as bad as some reviews say but once I rode one up just to make sure I was on it when it started going down. Not a deal killer. (I think if the elevators bother you, I can guess you are probably a negative person in general!). 
Thank you.
*****

- **Aspect Term & Sentiment Details:** 
  - For the "staff", all agents agreed on the positive sentiment; consolidated as "positive" with a consistent intensity score reflecting moderate praise.

Because the sentiment is highly positive related to quality (LOOOOOVE, Best feature), the category "food_drinks quality" is used. The intensity score is strongly positive (5).

- **Ignored Aspects:** The aspect "negative person" from Agent 2 is subjective speculation not reflective of the service, facilities, or hotel's review, hence omitted. Similarly, general gratitude from closing "Thank you" lacked specific evaluative content.

input_doc:
Farmer's Daughter is our favourite LA hotel....so much more fun and charm than anything at touristy Santa Monica or Bev Hills - so we stay here not for the amazing value (which it is) but because it feels more like the real LA to us - casual and quirky. Yes its a basic drive up Motel that has been renovated - but it comes together perfectly. 
 There is great shopping across the road at The Grove and a farmers market for snacks, a Whole Foods supermarket down the street and a number of very cool cafes/breakfast spots within walking distance. We also liked the breakfast at the onsite cafe called Tart.

input_doc:
What a pleasant surprise.
I was extremely worried going to NYC for the first time, as I had read various reviews of hotels, and wasn't sure what to expect.
The Salisbury was great.
First of all - Location, Location, Location - couldn't ask for a better position - within walking distance to all the great places of Manhattan, including a stone throw away from central park, and very close to broadway and times square, time warner building and various subway stations.
Room was large, clean, with 2 queen size beds and spacious cupboards and nice bathroom with ample hot water (appears to be a problem at some other hotels).
Amneties in the room include: complimentary coffee and teas daily with coffee machine in room, also has small fridge, room safe, iron, laundry service, vending machines on the third floor. TV and aircon in perfect working order - but who really cares about tv in new york - toooo much to do.
You will not find a better bargain than their $3 breakfast available to guests - includes coffee, fruit juices, an assortment of bagels and cream cheese, eggs and a variety of pastries - danish, muffins etc - 
Its an old hotel, but with great service, low price, highly recommended. 
If you want to find something to gripe about, there is no view (or wasn't from our room) as we had a brick building opposite us, but who really cares - you will be out in the streets of NYC most of the time anyhow.

input_doc:
On a recent holiday to NYC we decided to stay at the Fitzpatrick Manhattan - the hotel location on the corner of 57th and Lexington is hard to beat - shop weary partners can be dispatched to the uber trendy and buzzing hotel bar for a break allowing their other halves to escape to adjacent Bloomingdales or the many other nearby 5th Ave shopping meccas. We had a suite which was very spacious by New York hotel standards and was serviced several times daily - lovely bathroom, very comfortable king sized bed and a seperate sitting room and joy of joys windows which actually opened in all rooms!! (I'm not a fan of the US obsession with central air conditioning).
Where this hotel really wins however is with its staff - they are without exception friendly, helpful and prepared to go that extra mile to make sure that your stay is memorable.
We will be back!!!

input_doc:
We have used this hotel a few times for when we have friends or family in town and need extra sleeping space.
The staff is sooooo great. They are friendly, helpful, and efficient. 
The hotel has a great manager's reception in the evening, and a full hot breakfast in the morning. We had a room there for a few nights during the week and into the weekend, and the guests changed from business travelers to more families on the weekend. WIth families, there was a lot more activity in the atrium/lobby and pool, which might not appeal to some. Despite the bigger crowds over the weekend, we enjoyed the pool, hot tub, manager's reception, breakfast and the space in the suites. You can't beat the value.

input_doc: Our wedding day was perfect until we arrived at Westin La Cantera to find they had sold our room to someone else. My husband had been to the hotel 3 times in person. In fact, he was there the Monday before our wedding to make sure everything was in place. The director of sales even promised all sorts of extra amenities since it was our wedding night. When we arrived, the manager said they sold our room but offiered us a parlor room with a roll away bed!!! What a joke. Obviously, we went to another hotel, the Omni La Mansion which is a first class hotel. Thanks to La Mansion for an amazing room and wonderful service. I would not recommend La Cantera to anyone.

input_doc: This hotel is in a great location...we parked and walked to Coors Field and to eat dinner. the views were awesome from our room and from the indoor outdoor swimming pool. The breakfast buffet was very good!!!

per pi di 250 euro a camera pensavo di avere maggiori servizi e invece colazione non inclusa e no WIFI (che attenzione costa 14 dollari al giorno)
quando sono arrivata alle 17, la mia camera non era pronta e la scusa era che c'era un gruppo di persone e che non erano riusciti a preparare la camera...complimenti!
quando finalmente sono salita nella mia camera, improvvisamente entra il ragazzo con le valigie senza bussare e, quando ho sottolineato la cosa.. andato via senza nemmeno chiedere scusa.
diciamo che di per s l'hotel  carino, ma il personale no!!!

input_doc:
Hello everyone!!! Once again I trust the reviews and choose this hotel for a week in NY, and it was an excellent choice.
We have a wonderfull stay, in a very comfortable room. The staff is very good, they treated us as we were the only guests at the hotel (they were many families).
We have several breakfasts and dinners at the Gaby (inside th hotel), excellent food and service.
Overall the hotel it`s well located, inside the room you can`t feel the city, the satff is excellent . The last day we have the chek out at 3pm but we stayed until 6pm and they didin`t charged us a penny.
Very Nice!!! We will definitely come back.

input_doc: If you're looking for a pool, complimentary breakfast, and nice lobby great, but if you're looking for an affordable room, STAY AWAY at all costs!!! Cockroaches in room, three barrels of what was labeled non-hazardous waste outside my room (I wonder?), a police bust in the hotel room next to me at 3:30 a.m. for what I presume was drugs, non-stop noisy traffic, etc!!! May I say more? Of course! The high-speed Internet connection which they advertised did not work, one of two telephones did not work, and they didn't even dare ask me how my stay was. I wonder why??? This is being converted to high-rise condomimiums over the hotel!!! Oh my lord!!! I think they need to remove all guests for three-four weeks, fumigate the whole place and then only should the city of San Diego grant them a building permit, In fact, I'm writing the city of San Diego community development department to stop all plans for their condos until they get rid of their cockroaches and rodents!!!!

We booked through booking.com and got the standard room on the 15th floor. Room was fairly spacious but the decoration was 'dated' with old carpet.
No upgrade and coupons for us, helas....We arrived too early and were asked for a telephone number so that the reception lady could ring us when the rooms was ready; we are still waiting for the phone call....
Staff is very professional and friendly though and the hotel is a real landmark.

input_doc: We stayed here on our way back to NZ from Dallas Tx. The room was small but still very nice. The location, free shuttle, very friendly staff, made this a very pleasant stay indeed. The pool and hot tubs were also great and the rooms were very quiet with little or no noise from nearby aircraft taking off and landing. The view of the airport runway was a bonus! I suppose the only complaint was the over priced food at the hotel restaurant ($16 for cereal!) and the rather cold and unfriendly staff at the brasserie downstairs. And must they serve that awful Starbucks coffee!!!

My family arrived at 2 am with prior reservations.My daughter had been lifeflighted by helicopter to chop in critical condition.The desk clerk was mean and rude to us. The room was small and unclean.The next morning I paid 14 dollars for a pot of coffee as I was too exhausted to wander the hotel to find it.I called the front desk just to ask if the hotel if they had a shuttle to the childrens hospital and she was sooo rude that i finally got angry!The roomcost us almost $300 per night,Overpriced!

input_doc: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night as I couldn't bear to stay for the 10 nights I was booked in for, back in February 2007!!! I have been meaning to write a review on this hotel for a long time and have finally got round to it. Considering that this hotel is based in the centre of NYC, where everything happens, I'm astounded that the environmental health department haven't closed it DOWN!!! I'm disappointed that nothing has changed since 2007, when I stayed there! My visit was a night with bed bugs and I only realised that there was a problem the next morning when I had red spots all over my legs!!! Stay away from this hotel - budget yes, but it doesn;t have to be FILTHY no matter what your budget!!!

input_doc: Great hotel the price was good. The room had a great sitting area that may have been a sofa bed. The view was great. The bed was sooooo comfortable - my only tiny complaint would be the door from the bedroom to the sitting room had to remain closed when you use the closet - not really a complait but rather odd - sorry no free internet in the room only in the lobby - indoor and outdoor pools completed my stay!

I took my granddaughter to DC for summer vacation. We stayed here and we absolutely loved it! The concierge was exceptional, went out of his way to help us with everything. There was fresh cookies and milk for kids each night, plus kid books for them. The rooms were SOOO comfortable. The service was fantastic, and when we got caught in rain, we were brought warm towels as soon as we entered the lobby. We've stayed at the Willard, very expensive and nice, but just not as personal as it was at the Westin. This is where we will stay each time we go back to DC.

To consolidate the findings from the three LLM agents:

1. **Hotel Overall Sentiment**:
   - All three agents recognized the sentiment toward the hotel as a whole aspect. Agents 1 and 3 noted extremely positive feedback with terms like "Loved!!!!" and scored the sentiment intensity at 5. We unanimously categorize it under 'hotel general'.

2. **Staff/Service Sentiment**:
   - For the sentiment related to staff or service, agents 1 and 2 identified the aspect as "everyone" and "staff" respectively, while agent 3 combined staff sentiment with the hotel aspect. Considering the descriptive sentiment phrases used ("very friendly, professional, and eager to please") and its consistent positive interpretation across agents, we conclude a positive sentiment with an intensity score of 4, categorized under 'service general'. The term "staff" was chosen due to its precise reference to people providing service.

3. **Room Comfort/Noise**:
   - All agents acknowledged the concern about noise from the freeway as a negative sentiment. Agent 1 and 2 categorized this under 'rooms comfort', while agent 3 labeled it under 'location general' based on direction reference. The consolidated decision categorizes it under 'rooms comfort' because it is an immediate comfort issue noticed from room occupancy. An intensity score of -2 was suggested based on the repeated sentiment intensity across all agents.

input_doc: I have been staying at the staybridge on and off for 4 months for training for work. Jason the manager is great!!!!! The happy hour is good and the beer is cold. Customer service is great from the staff to managers. The rooms were clean and the staff accomdated our every need. It is the best place to stay in Northwest Austin

The web site is sooo much better than reality. The lobby is okay. The room is dark and the decor is lacking. The bed is subpar to anything found at the sheraton or westin. I am in a southern facing room and window does not allow much light in during the day. I was out of the room during working hours and my room was never cleaned.
One thing that is puzzling is this is THE HARD ROCK yet the rooms have old TV's and rather LARGE 6 CD disk changer similar to one I had in the 1980s. You would think with the brand Hard Rock they would be the first with ipod radios in the room.

input_doc:
after reading some reviews I was not sure if I had done a good thing but after passing the Labor day week end there, I have to say it was fine. week end with my son, I had ask for 2 twin beds got them. Not luxuous but clean. bid enough bathroom clean also **only 1 wash cloth for 2**
complimentary breakfast not more than okay, coffeee good.
will I got back yes. really close to Empire Stare, Macy's and very close walking from Time Square.

This is over priced for the crap that goes on here!!! The rooms, towels, bathroom, kitchen area, crappy. There is no "fitness center" or pool like the booking agent said but can travel 10 mins to another crappy extended stay. No ice machine either. The laundry is $2 per load and $2 for dry?! The kitchenware is lacking and a room for 4 has a set of three dish set! I come her once a year but I will never stay here again!!

This hotel scored excellent in every regard...The staff, especially Rory at the front desk and OJ were great!!! Valet parking made it especially easy to check in and out...Great food in the hotel too!!
I'll stay there again and again and have already referred some SF regulars from my home town, Monterey. Good value!!!
 A. Krusee

We have had a looooong flight from Paris, France and were craving for a good rest when we got there in the middle of the night -- not that easy to find coming from the airport i thought. The decor is an enchantement for the eyes, modern, clean, charming. The front desk clerk, a black young beauty welcomed us with warmth. The room was just perfect in every detail. Very quiet although the building sits on frontage road alongside the i10. We also were delighted by breakfast buffet for a very competitive price. We incidently shook hands with the manager while checking out. The lobby was full of smiling clients yet checkout was fast and clean. Houston Galleria where we spent the following afternoon is 7-8 miles away and heard a shuttle can take you there. Great place!

input_doc:
I love this Marriott for its location but also the awesome staff. This was my second time staying at the hotel and even better than my first two years ago. Upon arriving, my friend and I chatted with the woman who was checking us in. She mentioned the hotel wasn't very busy but would pick up over the weekend, and that she would be able to give us a room with two double beds instead of one king, which was great. After a couple more minutes of chit-chat we went to our room and realized-- WE GOT HOOKED UP!!! 
The room was huge by NY standards. There was plenty of space to walk around, a large closet and a nice-sized bathroom with a stand-alone shower and large tub with jets. The beds were super-comfy and had reading lights attached to the headboard. The view from the windows was cut off halfway down by the wall, but that wasn't a big deal since we weren't spending much time in the room anyway. I was a little sad to leave our room at the end of our stay, and though that rarely happens in the city with most rooms measuring the size of small closets, I have always had great luck with Marriott.

input_doc: this hotel oozes San Francisco chilled atmosphere - from the very cool doormen with their laconic sense of humour to the staff on every level. Afternoon free wine meet and greet for all guests is a great way to meet fellow travellers. But, it's the rooms that make your stay, they are soooo west coast seafront laid back style with bare brick and panelling - the building was the Del Monte warehouse in a former life. The hotel is walking distance from the famous pier 39 - The Eagle Cafe upper level for breakfast - just do it! it's so close to the cable cars they practically leave from the side door of the hotel. input_doc:
I chose this hotel after finding a great deal on expedia and paid less than $100 per night. Considering the price- this was a great place to stay. The room was nice and clean. I had a seperate sitting room and bedroom- each was a bit on the small side but both were comfortable. The siting room had a large flat screen TV and the king size bed was soooooo comfortable. The service was great but the valet parking was a little pricey. 
The hotel is not exactly walking distance to the museums and monuments but it's not too far either. I often times grabbed a cab which only cost me a few dollars each way and saved me the trouble of looking for parking once I got where I was going. I have no complaints about the hotel itself but it borders the business district so there is not much open in the area at night.

input_doc: This was our third stay at the Eliot Hotel. Each time we visit Boston we always try to stay at this beautiful boutique hotel. This stay was just as fantastic as our previous visits. The hotel is ideally located to Newbury Street and offers beautiful views of Commonwealth Ave. This time we enjoyed breakfast at Clio. Most hotel breakfasts are usually a little pricey, however the hotel offered us a $10 breakfast voucher for their continental bakery breakfast. input_doc: this room was the size of a dorm room,The room was not clean, headboard had hand print all over it as if somebody had gotten busy and they use the headboard to hold on(if you know what i mean) the floor hadn't beeen vaccum,the bathroom floor had hair on it and when we call for housekeeping the guy didn't know when the room was clean. the front desk assistance just apologize but did nothing, we was on the 20th floor, we wanted some ice we had to go back to the basement to get ice and not too mention only one elevator was working. it would had been nice if they could have told us at check in the ice was in the basement, and last but not least the valet parking was $36.00. (but after my husband and went out on the town when we came bck at midnight the guy at the desk was more helpful, he moved us to another room and offered us a late check out, would i ever stay there again the answer is NO, the young man that worked the midnight shift was awsome.(he put us in another room on the 38th floor) Tina Frazier

input_doc: We were in San Antonio for the first time with an army reunion. Picking the Crockett was a real winner. From the easy check-in to the expert advise on tours and restaurants; everyone was so very helpful. Eduardo was always available to answer any questions we had, or to point us in the right direction. Shirley Dyer, the Sales Manager at the hotel, was our most gracious "friend" the whole week of our stay. If we ever return to San Antonio, the Crockett it is! input_doc: My husband booked our first stay in New York as a 50th birthday surprise and the hotel delivered in almost every way. Just a couple of negatives. The receptionist said she would upgrade us but we only got what we had paid for!!! The room was excellent, the bed - well just 'heavenly' and the views from the 29th floor just amazing! My only other gripe is the huge charge for the internet and the fact that the business centre delivered a fax to our room 4 days after they received it!!! We never ate in the restaurant or drank in the bar due to the prices but there are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby so it really wasn't a problem. Perfect location too. If the hotel offer any good deals we will certainly be back here next time we visit New York!

input_doc: My husband and I have just returned from 6 days in this fab city, where we stayed at the mansfield. Having read some of the reviews on here we were a bit weary to say the least!! The moment we walked into the foyer we were put at ease, lovely comfy snug with a roaring fire, and free coffee and tea machine. The receptionist was so friendly and upgraded our room straight away, the room or should I say rooms were great and not what we were expecting, the bathroom was a little on the small side but clean and perfectly formed. My only critisism of the room was that there was no reall storage for clothes, a very small closet and no drawer space but apart from that it was great. Breakfast was basic but fresh and tasty, lots of pastrys and fruits aswell as toast and cereals, juice and coffee what more do you want for free!!! The location was excellent, slap bang in the middle of everything located on a lovely street with plenty of bars and restaurants. All in all fantastic.

input_doc: We really loved being at the Roosevelt. We were there for 2 nights with a special deal through Booking.com. If it wasn't for this special price, we would not have had the chance to book here. The room was really nice and the furniture, bed and tv were all of high standard. The only negative would be the tiny bathroom where there is nowhere to put your things and only one person can use at a time, but everything else was so good, and it's a historic building so it was easy to forgive this. I must admit the staff at checkin were excellent! The two young ladies greeted us with smiles and were very informative and we felt very comfortable. I would looooove to go back again.

input_doc: Stayed here for 4 nights, just a few blocks from times square made it a great location. the room was absolutely TINY - but it is New York, so we shouldn't have been surprised :) had a nice meal in the bar the first night we stayed - it always had live music the evenings we stayed there which was really nice... a jazz band one night, which added a lovely touch before we went out for the night.. the one thing that was SO annoying was the air con - possibly the loudest noise I have ever had to attempt to sleep through!!! it was really warm when we stayed so turning it off was not an option!! we asked the front desk to have a look, they installed a new one which was marginally smaller but still not great - it was the one downside of the hotel that would make me think twice about returning... otherwise, no complaints!

input_doc:
this is a great hotel - there is a bit of a walk to the thick of things so if you want to just walk out of your hotel and be at all the attractions then this is not the hotel for you!
Our check in wasnt great - it was the start of our honeymoon and we had noted this on our booking and that we wanted non-smoking room. Our honeymoon was hardly acknowledged and we were not given a non-smoking room. In fact we were told that if we paid the guy who was checking us in some more money he would give us a nicer room!!!! Needless to say we checked into a ok room for the night. Next morning i phoned to ask to move to a non-smoking room and got a very nice lady who not only moved us to a non-smoking room but moved us into the newly renovated tower. This is the tower with the pool in it - so if your booking try and get into this tower!
Rest of hotel was lovely, good breakfast but very expensive if you dont have it included in your room rate.
An ok stay but slightly shadowed by the horrible check in to start with.

input_doc:
The hotel is nice, clean, and has a beautiful pool area, but what really sets this hotel apart is the staff!! From our pickup at the airport to our dropoff at the airport 2 days later, each staff member we encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful!! 
In addition to the wonderful staff, the Manager's Reception each night was fabulous: free drinks and appetizers (excellent chips and salsa made at the hotel!) We had lunch at the cafe also and it was delicious; everything is made fresh there at the hotel. And let's not forget the made to order breakfast each morning....delicious!! 
The pool was hopping and there were a lot of kids laughing and playing, but when in your room, you can not hear the pool noise which is a definite plus. The pool area is very pretty, too, with plenty of tables, lounge chairs, and towels provided.
The next time I'm in Phoenix, I will definitely stay at this hotel. If you are looking for a moderately priced hotel with staff that will make you feel at home, you should stay here, too!

input_doc:
This is a very over rated Hotel. The rooms are a lot smaller than what they appear, beds are not very comfortable and every time you toss or turn you have to beware of the end table catching your eye. Yes, they did do a lot of remodeling, but in order to get their money for remodeling they have a lot of hidden fees such as $20.00 per day to park even though you're one of their guests. Not to mention when most hotels offer free continental breakfast you have to pay $9.00 per plate for cold, bland, and tasteless food. Save your money and go to either Lulus or Mi Tierra for breakfast. 
Not to mention that they must have a deal with the taxi cabs when we asked for a nice after hours bar or club they gave us names a club that cost over $40.00 per cab ride one way so beware!!!!!!!!!! Will never stay there again and do not recommend this hotel. The hotel I do recommend that are spacious and reasonable is Best Western Alamo Suites; we stayed due to having to leave for our San Antonio trip a day early to avoid severe weather.

input_doc:
Just returned from a truly fabulous stay at this Hilton property! It has a boutique hotel feel to it, which I loved.
Positives:
-Rooms are hip, modern, new and very clean
-The property is not huge, like the awful Hilton near Times Square, so I never had to deal with lines, elevator waits, an over-crowded lobby, etc.
-Beds are so clean, and comfortable  this was the best sleep Ive had, next to my stay at the Andaz, last year in NYC
-Location is good, if you are looking to not be in the midtown area  great food and stores are in walking distance or a really quick cab ride (I was able to walk to Chelsea)
-Staff was helpful
-Great value! The nightly rate was $40 cheaper per night than the Hilton property in Times Square - and this place is sooo much nicer, newer, quieter and cleaner!
-So quiet - that is a HUGE plus for me!
Negatives:
-Because it isnt a spralling hotel, there arent cabs lined up outside, if you are looking to grab a quick taxi. Im the mornings the bell desk was happy to hail cabs down though.

input_doc:
My wife and I had a great stay here. The location is great! Right on the riverwalk. We only stayed one night and didn't notice that there was a button on the elevator (the B or basement button)that took you straight down to the riverwalk. The meals and drinks that are included are a nice addition, but you are sooo close to so many restaurants that it's not necessary. For this reason I would probably stay somewhere else next time, but I have nothing to complain about. It's just that it kinda takes away from the riverwalk experience a little bit with all the nice restaurants within close walking distance, but that's just my opinion. 
Very good hotel though

input_doc:
for real. i came on july 13 (it's been less than 12 hours later) and i've moved to another hotel. i got there at 630. 
the check in clerk was realllllly rude and short with me. 
their printer did not work. 
their computer froze up. 
the room key given to me did not open the door b/c the door lock was broken
the next room i got wasn't "newer" by what i thought it would mean. 
the air conditioner vibrated really loudly and 
when someone flushed the toilet above me it made a horrendously loud sound that made me jump off the phone with my husband because i actually felt someone was in the room
the remote control was missing
the fridge was blowing hot air
and behind the fridge was newspaper and a plastic bottle
nail clippings were on the floor
and you could tell things hadn't been wiped down
i left by midnight b/c i couldn't sleep as the bed was LITERALLY VIBRATING from the A/C 
the toilet flushed by someone else made me even more rattled
and i just didn't feel safe
and while i told the rude clerk what was going on the general manager did nothing and just stood there
only upside
apparently i got checked out as if i'd never been there so no charge
thank goodness financially it will show i wasn't there but mentally, still stuck with it in my 
head :( 
will check financials in the next week to make sure i wasn't charged
not so much a good place at all

input_doc: After staying one night at the Raddison Fisherman's Wharf - only because by mistake, i booked one night instead of two, I was lucky enough to book Hyatt on priceline for about 200.00 the same day. It is in a nice location, hotel is very nice, customer service was excellent. We only stayed for one night so the only review i can give is that the room was great! Beds were soooo comfortable and for 2 friends staying in a room we had plenty of room! it was great! my only negative would be that we got lost SEVERAL times trying to find our room out of the elevator. input_doc: Very very good!!! Good service, rooms, view, vicinity with important places of New York City

While my husband worked, I was able to come along & enjoy New York for a couple days! At the W NY Hotel I found Lisa the concierge so helpful!! I wanted to take the train to China Town for Dim Sum & then shop in SOHO. She gave me directions & went out of her way to explain how to take the train! I got back without a problem (this is probably funny to local people, but we're from Seattle). I went back to see her again for a dinner reservation & she recommended" Luna" an Italian restaurant. Our dinner was great & was all we had hoped for! I want to thank Lisa for all of her assistance in making our trip easy & fun!!! Zoey Brumm, Zo Hair Salon & SOZO Hair Studio, Kirkland, WA.

input_doc:
The rooms and bathrooms are renovated, very modern and comfy. I wasn't too fond of how the breakfast area was set up; waiting for your omelet might cause you to be late if you don't give yourself an extra 15 minutes. I enjoyed the location of the hotel. A short walk to see the bats fly from under the bridge (which unfortunately did not show during my stay), and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. If you get a room facing downtown, your view at night is spectactular.
BEWARE: Parking rates per day are ridulous ($17 to self-park and $23 for valet). Make sure you take your walking shoes, because you'll have to make it across the cracked and broken up sidewalks to the sloooooow elevator before you finally make it to your car.

input_doc:
We stayed with the kids for 3 nights. Hotel is half block from Michigan avenue @ ONtario street, I have to confess that location made me choose this hotel. This is an old building with extra small rooms (No problem here). The problems were mainly in the bathroom. Toilets should be the least ecological in the world, everytime somebody washed its hands, we had to suffer all the waste since it was soooo clogged. And I stayed for 3 NIGHTS!!! and I had no water pressure in the shower so, shower time was a real nightmare. I reported it at least 7 times and it was until our las t night that someone came to look at it and didnt fix it. Room was cleaned only half way. 
Believe me, pay a bit more or at stay a bit outside the city this hotel is a BAD idea

input_doc: I have stayed at this hotel at least once a year since 2005. Everything is wonderful here and I highly recommend high floor executive level for great views and rooms. I have not eaten here or taken room service. The hotel is clean and well appointed. The only real problem is that I think this gem has raised its prices waaaay too high. I recall booking a junior suite in 2005 for about $160/nt and now that is over $300. Still, this is a great hotel and I highly recommend it.

**Rationale:**

1. **Hotel Sentiment**: Recognizing "hotel" as an aspect term with sentiment ranging from neutral to strong positive based on the specific sentence context. The initial mention of staying since 2005 is generally factual, so it remains neutral. "Everything is wonderful here" leads to a strong positive sentiment for the overall hotel.

2. **Room Service**: Consistently regarded as neutral across agents since no opinion term is expressed.

3. **Hotel Cleanliness**: "Clean" and "well appointed" are consistently positive across agents, indicating a moderately strong sentiment.

4. **Price Sentiment**: The sentiment about the price being "waaaay too high" is negative, with a strong intensity. This is consistent among the agents.

5. **Room Comfort**: There's agreement on rooms providing "great views" and generally being positively described.

This final reconciliation integrates the consensus from the agents, choosing sentiment intensity scores that accurately reflect the combined evaluations.

input_doc: Bear in mind that this hotel is being rennovated. Located in a set back area the rooms are clean and very functional. I found the staff very friendly and accomidating, they had me in a room before check in at three. Found that prices for food and snacks to be on par with all other chains. There is a gas station close that will rip you off!!! Close to Carmel and a perfect spot to stay if you want to go downtown Indy or just stay in the Carmel area. Can't say enough about it and wonder if people that review believe they are suppose to receive a five star experience at a three star hotel for a motel six price. One other major compliment is that this hotel host the service men and women of Our country. They keep them in this hotel the night before they leave for boot camp and beyond. My hats off to this property and as we marines always say Semper Fi!!!

input_doc:
Spent a pleasant weekend at the Hampton Inn. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the bed was really comfortable and the breakfast was above average. While there was no street noise, the heating unit was VERY noisy, despite ear plugs.
Can't beat the location - all of the main tourist attractions are within a 20 - 25 minute walk. The hotel is really close to the Reading Terminal Market which is well worth a visit. 
A number of reviewers have compalined about the homeless people - the trick is to avoid Race Street. At night your best bet is to walk along Walnut or Chestnut (wider, busier, bettter lit) then up 13th.
If you come by plane there is no need for a car - the train from the aiport runs every 30 minutes ($7 per person) and the Market Street East stop is around the corner from the hotel.

input_doc:
We've stayed in a number of Hiltons across the world and have always found them to be of a very similar high standard. This one is nowhere near the same
Located on the borders of a very dodgy area it is dowdy, unwelcoming, with unhelpful staff. The lines for check in are longer than those at an airport-clearly staffing does not match the throughflow of guests
The taxi dropped us off and there was nobody around to help with our luggage which we had to drag into the Reception area. We arrived after 2pm after a 10 hour flight and 8 hour time difference to be told that our rooom wasn't ready and that it wouldn't be until after 2pm! The lounge area which is one of the dowdiest we have seen was full-it took a further half an hour to get our room and then it was not what we'd booked
The only hotel we stayed at in the US we would not recommend
San Francisco and the surrounding areas are great though

input_doc:
I would echo all the positives about this hotel, and would probably stay here again IF the price is OK. I paid $1250 for 4 nights in July and given the Location I was happy with That.
Rooms are small, I can only compare to Hilton Garden Inn a couple of blocks away, which had much bigger rooms and beds, where I stayed first time I visited, but this year the price was too high and I went for this place.
I used The limo service back to Newark, which was great and cost $102 including tips and tolls and suited us for a hassel free last day.
Breakfast nice as is free wine, noticed some guests seemed to 'over use', this service, seems they saw it as a money saving excercise rather than go out and eat which is a shame.
I think the hotel is best suited to couples, and the staff were all very friendly. 
My only concern was the lack of visible security, no one asked to seee any ID when we came in at night, which they certainly did at the Hilton last year before you were allowed on the elevator.

input_doc:
We stayed at the W last month and were completely dissapointed. we had actually booked for 9 nights, but moved after 2 it was soooooo bad.
Firstly my husband arrived separately from a conference in the U.S. He was not allowed to check in as they didn't have his name on the booking (despite his name being on every booking form I had, as well as receipts from the hotel when checking out).He therefore had to wait 3 hrs, in the lobby whilst we arrived.
Our rooms, we had 2, were tiny, noisy and bright all night.
The staff were rude and arrogant, with attitude, they were so busy looking at themselves, they had no time to assist anyone. 
An extremely disapointing beginning to a 2 week family holiday. Fortunately we relocated to The London NY, which was far better value, and fabulous in every way.

input_doc: I had to attend a function in downtown L.A. and discovered this gem of a hotel. I was a little worried about my choice at first, as the lobby was just okay. The lobby has a dark green carpet that has seen better years, and the front desk staff aren't in a hurry to provide quick check-in service. Once we got to our room I realized that a hotel can't be judged on first impressions alone. We were given a beautiful corner room that was oversized, glamorous, and oh so comfortable! The room had a king bed with Frette linens, the bathroom had Frette towels, and there were two Frette robes in our closet - aaah comfort. The decor of the rooms is very designer, and at a rate of $140 a night -including breakfast for two -this is a secret worth sharing.

input_doc:
This hotel is directly across from the WTC building site so the jack hammers work from 7:30am till dark every day except Sunday. The WTC project is about 4 years from completion.
The hotel believes in loud techno music and uncomfortable seating everywhere in the hotel. The staff said this was a W "soft opening", we thought it a "hard opening". 
Rooms were tiny but the site across the street at least interesting! Beds were good and staff tried to be helpful but nothing quite worked from our heating unit to our friends' safe.
Lots of money for a hotel that fell short of what it should be!!!

This is the second time we have stayed here and we will continue to stay here each time we go to either Hurrican Harbor, Six Flags, Rangers game or Cowboy game. I love the attitude of the employees willingness to help with all your questions or if you are looking for a certain place. The room was great and clean!!!!! Thanks for the great stay!!!!

input_doc: Stayed one night, ate in the lounge and in one of the restaurants and had a massage at the spa. The Spa was fantastic and we definitely received great service. The food was very good - had a light lunch in the lounge and the breakfast buffet in the morning. It is not far from the museums but definitely not in a night time hot spot, but it is DC, we took cabs to go out for dinner and drinks. Great water views. Our room was nice, we had a regular room, not one of the suites. The bathroom was AMAZING, it was almost the same size as our room and had a spa tub. Nice turn down service at night and the bed was sooooo comfortable. I did not want to get up.

input_doc:
I stayed at the Americana Inn in nov 2008. As a 22 year old girl travelling alone, i was so pleased to find you had to buzz to get in the front door and the room could be double locked inside.The staff were sooo friendly and very helpful. Though the weather was very cold out, it was very toasty and warm in my room! 
My room was very clean and bed was made every day. It wasn't facing on to the road so it was very quiet at night (except i was right by reception so could hear people coming in and out). The shared bathrooms were always spotless and i never had to wait to use one. My only niggle was slight draft in my room coming through the gap where the air con unit was set in the window, but thats it!!! (i just slept at the other end of the bed)
 It is a great location for a first timer to new york and really great quality and safe place to stay on a budget and i would stay there again!

input_doc:
A buddy and I were working the "24 Hours of LeMons" race at Charlotte Motor Speedway and needed a place to crash. Since I had Wyndham Rewards points I booked a room for Friday night so we didn't have to drive down at 0 dark 30 and he booked one for Saturday night. We were both pleasantly surprised at the friendliness of the receptionist when we checked in Friday. We were all joking as I filled out the paperwork.
The room wasn't anything special and if one of the grills being off the A/C unit offends you, pass this one by. But it was clean, the bed slept well and it was one of the quietest rooms I've stayed in in a long time. Evidently they put sound deadening in the wall when they built it because we heard a little noise from the hall but nothing through the walls.
When I checked out Saturday morning we asked if we could get the same room for Saturday night and the receptionist checked us in as we waited. Could not believe how little hassle we had.
The good: super friendly staff; good sound deadening; good beds
The not so good: towels were worn out; no internet (I had a full WiFi signal but no connection however it was late and we were tired so I didn't call the desk)
The totally unexpected: the steak house across the street has a wonderful breakfast and they are open Sunday morning!!!

input_doc: When I checked in, I was given room key only to find out that I was put in a room with one king bed even though I had booked 2 queen beds. We could not fit all of our travelers on one king bed so I went back to inquire at the front desk. "Oh, I forgot to tell you that we don't have two queens". I had confirmation number, but not only did they fail to provide the room I had contracted for, but they would not adjust the rate of the room!!!! We had to sleep with multiple "cots" with no apologies from the management and no adjustment for our room that was different than what we booked (I produced the printed confirmation and confirmation number immediately upon my discovering the error). I don't mind if something bad happens out of control of the hotel, but they should at least inform the traveler and try to make adjustments as soon as they are notified.

input_doc:
The place is lovely, but the service is really just getting underway - case in point - the Starbucks ran out of coffee!!! During my conference my entire table didn't get a lunch plate - the server said 'oops' and walked away.
But, ALL that melted away once everybody found the pool - it was perfect. 86 degrees year round - lots of space an amenities and a great poolside staff. Loved the lazy river and the zero-depth pool that stayed shallow enough for my kids to play in all day.
Rooms are average but nice - not sure who decided there should be longhorn artwork in every room... that's a little creepy. 
Make sure to visit the sports bar with the giant wall of 50 foot tvs.
Location: a solid $50 cab ride from the Riverwalk - not a plus. But a lovely view of the hills in all directions from the resort.

input_doc: arrived at 23;30 very helpfull check in desk staff who pointed us in the right direction,very impressed with the size of the room the king sized bed which 4 people could have slept in!!!! the only drawback which some other people have mentioned was the noise ,mainly from toilets being flushed also doors slamming at all hours . we had taken earplugs with us just in case and we were glad we did!!!! apart from the noise everything about the hotel is great , the room hoovered each day used towels were changed daily(unlike other hotels we have stayed in were the used towels were still ther the next day) every thing was just right only had one problem with a member of the check in staff who when i wanted some advice she spoke to me as if i was stupid !!!!! the location of the hotel is good not far from central park and most other places are not that far away if you like walking .we booked a car for the return journey to the airport this was done at the front desk it cost $60 including tolls and tip took just over 40 mins to jfk, much better than being stuck in the airlink van transfer for god knows how long as we were on the arrival pick up from jfk. we think that we would certainly stay here again if we go back

Granted, I stayed at the Westin almost two years ago...but I stayed here for a full week and overall had a great experience. Yes, the rooms are odd-shaped and pretty tiny...and it's pretty scary to look out the huge floor to ceiling windows, down at the street below (I was wayyyyyyy up there!), but the bed, sheets, and comforter were SO comfy, I had a hard time pulling myself out of bed (even during the day!). I'd love to find out where Westin gets their bedding b/c it is some of the best around. Bathroom was very clean...always a plus! The hotel is in a great location and the downstairs bar isn't too bad (dark and lounge-y). Wasn't a huge fan of San Fran but if I went back, I'd definitely stay here again.

input_doc: This hotel very obviously caters to the business world, but there were plenty of couples and some families, too. Staff was courteous and prompt. My biggest complaint would be the $48/day fee to park!! Our room was clean & had a spectacular view out to the river and lake (our room was in the hotel's west tower, in the northeast corner, 6th floor). We got to take in the fireworks out on the lake from our room both Friday and Saturday nights. Great location for touring the city - Millenium Park is just a few blocks to the south, Navy Pier is a not far to the east, it's right on the river (there are restaurants tucked under the major bridges/roads, right along the river!), plus it's just off of Michigan Avenue's fabulous shopping & surrounding restaurants (there is soooooo much amazing food there!). The architectural river tour was wonderful - the river a great vantage point to take in the city's wealth of architecture.

input_doc:
I cannot say enough about this property from the staff as soon as you walk in the door at check-in and the bell desk to the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. I could sit here and talk about all the wonderful amenities, but just know they are all great! The concierges are top notch and know all the best spots. Showers, Beds, Rooms, Elevators, all top notch ( I say elevators because of past frustration with elevators at the nearby Marriott Marquis ). Always willing to accommodate and help. As a Marriott Gold Member, I received free continental-ish breakfast (did have eggs and sausage as well) on weekdays. The restaurant in the lobby is a little pricey, but most people just eat out in the city.
#1 Property in NYC!!!

input_doc: My wife and I took a long weekend pre-Christmas trip to NYC and simply loved SOHO GRAND! Very different compared to the usual 'business' hotels. Stayed there Aug 14-18th room was a bit small but it is NY ! 
PROS: EXTRA close to Times Square....well close to everything it seems
 Clean hotel with clean rooms and bathrooms. 
 Free Wi-Fi
 Free upgrade when i said there for Honeymoon
 Able to leave luggage at front desk if room not ready on check-in
CONS: A/C was hit and miss but maintainance was quick each time. 
 (Did tell us that we could switch rooms if we wished)
 Breakfast over priced, signage not clear, especiall with such great deals a few min

input_doc: We got a discounted rate at this hotel which made it an excellent value! The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are nice, the beds are sooo comfortable, the shower was nice and hot (and stayed that way for a long time). All in all, it's a great hotel to stay in. This is my third time here, and each visit has been great!

After checking out several hotels on the Riverwalk, I selected Hotel Valencia for a brief reunion between my husband and myself (after a six month military deployment). I chatted with a HV representative online before creating a reservation that combined three of their packages. input_doc: My husband and I went to San Antonio for a concert the next day. Being close to the freeway, we didn't hear a sound! The front desk lady was great, even though we got there after midnight. Called the hotel, and Amber stated she found the remote and would send it back to my home. Talk about customer service!!!!! Will definitely stay again.

input_doc:
We were booked to stay here 9-13 November 2011 and it was amazing. Rooms were very comfortable and clean - as we would expect. The beds have to be the most comfortable we have ever experienced in a hotel. Our room was by the lifts on the 15th floor (not that we heard them) and although we didn't have a view this did not spoil our stay. The service was superb and the food choice for breakfast was unbeliveable. Prices were as expected for a hotel of this calibre although we didn't touch the mini bar as felt this was quite pricey!! Well placed to explore this fabulous city and we were very lucky with the weather.
Would we stay here again? - you bet we would!!!

input_doc:
From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the front desk (Daniella I think was her name) to my meeting with the sales team (Kathy is terrific) (I am planning a business meeting there), to the bar staff, Valet staff...everyone.....this hotel excels in every area
It is so comfortable, so quiet, and yet still so close to the Riverwalk hot spots.
Some hotels that "try" to give great service it comes off as fake but for the staff of the Contessa it really seems as if they care that you are having an outstanding stay ....
Do yourself a favor and visit this hotel....... I see where it would be perfect for a romantic get away yet functional for a business meeting ...

input_doc: My boyfriend and i spent 5 days at the Roosevelt and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The location was perfect The room size was ok to us we didn't have anything to complain about. The room was always clean and the sheets fresh and crisp. The bathroom was also clean and whilst small it was just fine for the both of us. May i just add that the bed was soooo comfortable we proceeded to change our bed as soon as we came back from our holiday as we could no longer bear the thought of sleeping on a less than the Roosevelt standard type of bed i could write a whole lot about the bed... The tv was nice there was a wide range of tv shows, movies, news on tv. The hotel food was nice though a little expensive i would definitely recommend the Roosevelt hotel to my family and friends in fact next time i'm in NYC i'll probably go back there.

input_doc:
We had booked at the last minute (pending storm changed our plans on the Cape) and got a great price on Expedia. Wonderful room, service was exceptional but no real view of the water (I'm guessing the Expedia price). The staff was extremely friendly, told us where to go and the quickest way to get there. We're used to walking so we stayed away from public transportation - the last day we were there we broke down and took a cab back because it was toooooooo hot! 
Valet pricing is pricey - $42 a day.
Recommend the Birch Bar - great music, quiet and good food. 
Also, we had one wonderful dinner at Sorellina - it's across from the Westin Copley Place and it was AMAZING. The service was impeccable and we're still sighing remembering how delicious the food was.

input_doc: I just returned from a one night business trip to NYC with two colleagues - we were going to be working at 3rd and 58th so I looked on line for a hotel nearby, and found The Lombardy on 56th at Lexington - it had great reviews so we booked in there - FABULOUS! I had a one bedroom apartment, not just a room, it was great, I only wish I had been staying longer to be able to take advantage of the spacious living room and fully equipped kitchen...the bathroom was great, the bed was sooooooo comfortable - there was an LCD tv in the bedroom and the livingroom - there was a safe in the walk in closet, always good to have on a trip. The AC worked well, everything was clean - the staff were terrific and allowed us to keep all of our luggage in one of the rooms for a late check out at 3pm (instead of noon) - then, they allowed us to leave our luggage in a locked room in the lobby, as we were still working and needed to leave for the airport about 5pm - they arranged a car to take us to the airport in Newark too - I didn't think it was possible to find a spacious clean room in NYC in a great area, within walking distance of everything, in July for an affordable rate - $251.93 a night! Everyone complains about the size of NYC hotel rooms, if you want space, check in at The Lombardy!

input_doc:
We were to stay at another hotel in DC, but it's review's did not live up to it. So we checked out the same time wel checked in. So we called the Mayflower and found the staff to be overly friendly and helpful. Reservations agent, Allan, was quick, kind, and eager to assist us. The front desk person, Cheryl, was equally helpful in making our trip an enjoyable and rememberable one. Thanks to them both!!! 
The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds, lets just say we had to have two wake up calls to get us up because we just wanted to sleep. The maid service was prompt and thorough.

input_doc: My husband and I stayed for 3 days in NYC in September 2012. We LOVED our stay at the W New York. This hotel is in a perfect location, walked to everything. 5th Avenue, Central park, Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, all within walking distance. Room was great and comfortable, staff was very friendly and accommodating. We took a red eye there and got checked in at 8am and upgraded for free! Great time away for my husband and I. Loved all the bathroom products and the bed was soooo comfy! Room got really dark that we slept too long one morning, we were sleeping sooo good. Loved everything about our stay, cannot wait to return!

input_doc:
I had stayed here in the past for work, and thought they had remodeled...NO WAY!!! When I stayed here early this month my room was so gross. My sheets were dirty, the walls had stains, the lighting barley worked in the bathroom and the carpet was dirty .There were no suitcase caddies, so you had to place your suitcase on the other bed, if you had one, and just pray the cover was clean. I did call to have my sheets changed, and was told housekeeping was gone for the day...3pm?? Anyway a maintenance man, who had paint all over him brought of a new set of pillow cases. 
There is absolutey no reason to stay here...there are no restaurants and it's not even that close to the new airport, but is in the flight path as I heard airplanes all night

input_doc: We were in town for an Ohio State Football game (as were all guests is seemed:) My husband and I are OSU alumni and we brought our kids to their first game. 15 minute walk to stadium, super clean, convenient shuttle to nearby shops and restaurants, wendys, bob evens and tim hortons all right next door, SUPER friendly staff and bar in the lobby....what more can I say?! In addition to the game, this was a chance for my husband to visit us. He is ii the Marine Corps and away at school for a year. My only complaint is that he arrived late at night so I left him a key at the front desk. When he picked it up, they did not ask to see his ID. I would have preferred they had. Minor issue.........I HIGHLY suggest this hotel if you want to be near campus for game day or any other reason.

input_doc: Stayed 4 nights in Yotel, Times Sq. It was quite an experience - a visit to the future. Room had everything we needed, travelled without kids so we didn't need any extra space. I would definetely recommend this place and I would definetely come back or stay at Yotel in some other city. input_doc: I stayed at the Arizona Grand Hotel last week with my two small children (age 7 months and 3 1/2). We stayed in two adjacent suites instead of renting a two bedroom villa, which was sooo much less expensive, and was the perfect amount of space. My girls are too small for the water park, but they really enjoyed the pool that was right outside our room. It was fairly quiet, except for the last night where a dinner was held poolside for some corporate event. Even then, it wasn't terribly noisy, but it was enough to keep me up past my normal bed time. My only other complaint is that I was hoping that they had more fridge space for snacks because the food was fairly expensive there. Most of the fridge was taken up with mini bar food, though, so we couldn't keep anything that needed refrigeration in the room. All in all a good experience, though!

input_doc: My husband and I stayed at Hotel on Rivington in October 2012. We arrived Friday 26th and departed on Thursday 1st November so we were there when Hurricane "Sandy" hit. The hotel is fantastic we had booked a High room corner with balcony and we were upgraded to a room with a bath tub in it. The room was much larger than I was expecting and the bed was soooo comfortable. The hotel's Co-Op restaurant food and service was excellent. The staff were so friendly and professional even through the lack of power and hot water after Sandy hit the entire team were in high spirits and looked after us very well. The location was excellent, a short walk to Greenwich and SoHo....much better than being in the tourist hub of Times Square. Can't say a bad word about this hotel.

input_doc:
Nightly wine tasting, funky rooms, yummy cookies, super shuttle service, free parking & helpful staff...all within walking distance to the BEST ice cream shop...
Need I say more???

My first night at this place so far looking pretty good. I'm on the 8th floor in a King Executive room. The bed is nice with lots of extra pillows etc. As a business traveler the one thing I'm really liking is the lamps by the bed have 2 plugins on the base of each of them!!! This is great for charging the laptop/cell so I can have them right by/convenient. I hate having to go digging behind the beds/bedstands to find plugins. There was a bathrobe/slippers on the bed when I got here as well as chocolates on the pillows. I am diamond w/ hhonors which might have counted for some of the stuff. The bathroom is very nice and they even provide a little squishy scrubby shower thing which is cool never seen a hotel provide that before and I travel quite a bit. All in all a pretty good place.

input_doc: One little thing was something that only "kinda" bothered me but with San Antonio being my home town and the heat/humidity...I understood it but it may really bother some. input_doc:
Stayed at the Wellington during the week of Thanks Giving. First trip to NY.
19th floor room was, while not large, was big enough for the 2 of us, was comfortable and clean with maid service every day, the staff polite and helpful, even extended our use of the room on final day, due to late flight back to the UK, at no extra cost. 
Only suggestion is that a kettle, for tea and coffee making, in the rooms would have been a bonus....
Having read some of the reviews was a little worried but having stayed there would stay again.
Location was great, able to visit all we wanted to see either by walking or use of public transport, subway station and bus stops right outside of hotel.
Local deli's provide a wide range of foods. 
With the window open got the real sounds of the hustle and bustle of the city, just like the films....
Would recommend it to friends and family.

input_doc: The hotel was right behind Sheraton which was connected to Prudential Center. It's only across the road but it was raining so hard that I had to pay $15 for an umbrella which wasn't very good! For this price, they could have gotten a nice one that is strong enough for Boston rain. The room was ok with flat screen tv, though I feel it's more like 3* hotel. Perhaps it's a small lobby or something. The staffs were pretty cold and I didn't remember seeing them smile at all, except for the bellboy that helped me with my bags when I left. I also got a rash on my face the next morning so I didnt' know whether I got it from the bedbug or from their towels. Also water was running all night from the tub which was annoying. For the price I paid, it's way toooooooo much. I paid over $300 for one night as I couldn't find anything else during that week.

input_doc: BEWARE!! I was there for a research conference. I had to call my husband, but since the lobby was loud, and my roommate was sleeping, the only quiet place I could talk was the gym (since it was late and no one was in there). There was a maid who came in and then left. Later, a security guard came to me, and said that the maid complained about me saying I was "acting suspicious and saw me sniffing the equipment for an hour." I told him I was there to talk on the phone, so he forced me to show my room key. After I showed him, he left but came back 20 mins later and continued to make ridiculous accusations that i was in the gym to "sniff" the equipment. So ridiculous!!! The rooms are also very small, and it is hard to sleep with the loud train passing by.

input_doc: When I was looking for hotels in Chicago most that I came across cost waaaay more than the Holiday Inn. I was grateful when I found such reasonable prices considering the prices of the other hotels in the area. I was so excited to find that the hotel was exceptionally nice considering the price which makes it a no brainer as to where we will stay any time we visit Chicago! We had a nice view of the city and the river below, our room was spacious, clean, and the bed and pillows were sooo comfortable! Being attached to the Merchandise Mart was great because we could walk to coffee shops without having to go outside, and being able to walk to the metro through the Merchandise Mart was great! A few blocks away is Lou Malnati's which has great deep dish pizza and on the bottom floor of the Merchandise Mart I really liked the blueberry muffin I had at Au Bon Pain. I am very happy with my experience and am grateful that I saved hundreds of dollars by staying here!

input_doc: I stayed at the Westin for a conference and absolutely LOVED the room. The room was very clean, the beds were soooo comfortable, the shower with its double head was great, the TV was a plasma screen, and wireless worked very well. The only problems I had was the remote control battery dying and the internet not working after the 3rd day, but the staff people I spoke with to correct these problems were more than courteous and very prompt and professional. I would stay here again, even for vacation, just for the beds, shower, and TV!

input_doc: I was a bit worried reading some of the reviews before I stayed here with my mother for two nights.... But I have to say I found it no problem.... great location.... nice restaurant around the corner from the hotel which the porter recommended.... Our room had 2 double beds with fridge, microwave etc.... I would definitely stay here again..

We stayed here for 3 nights before we went on our cruise to Alaska. We loved it. We walked to Pike's Market area. There is plenty of shopping in the area. There are several restaurants, mini-markets, and other places a traveler might need to shop. The staff was helpful and the concierge was very accomodating. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. We were also near the monorail and took it over to the Space Needle. We will definitely stay here again. Loved it!!!

input_doc: Bed was soooo comfy. Breakfast was excellent. Tv could have been larger & easier to navigate. Would have been nice to have a small fridge. But loved the room, the decor, location, & service. Would definitely stay again :)

I recently stayed at The Cooper Square Hotel wanting it to be the Soho Grand but as it was 150 usd cheaper I decided to give it a go! I arrived with my husband feeling sulky and sullen because it wasnt the Soho Grand which I visit on a regular basis but once I'd lifted my sulky face out of my handbag I realised we were in for a nice surprise! The reception you receive is great! No standing hanging around to check in. As soon as you arrive your case is swept away and you are told to take a seat in the library, offered a glass of fizz or wine whilst they check you in - perfect! The rooms are typically new york small but clean, light and airy and quiet - no honking of ny taxis here!!! I must say the bed is adorable and I slept like a log every night - the duvet and pillows were heavenly too! 
The bar and restuarant in the hotel are really cool and the drinks and food are fab!
The area around the hotel is definitely developing so not as sleek as soho or uptown but really interesting with some gorgeous little bars and restaurants to discover in the local area.
I'd recommend the hotel but wouldnt stay in your room too long as you may start to get cabin fever - theres too much going on outside your room anyway so thats not going to be a problem!!

input_doc: Loved it! Loved the decor, location, bar, bed.....everything. We stayed for our 3rd anniversary and it was so lovely. We hated to leave.

With a little trepidation after reading the hotel's description of its petite room, I booked the room for a trip in which I couldn't find any other place to stay in downtown Boston.
